summary_text: ExxonMobil launched commercial carbon transport and storage networks for industrial customers, marking its entry as an operator in this space. The company expects three additional CCS projects to begin operations in 2026, expanding its lower carbon business activities and carbon management services.

headline: ExxonMobil Sued Over Alleged Monopoly on Gulf Coast CO2 Pipelines
summary_text: ExxonMobil faces expanded antitrust claims in Texas court accused of leveraging its dominant CO2 pipeline network to stifle competition in the blue ammonia market. The lawsuit alleges Exxon blocked pipeline access to favor its own low-carbon hydrogen and ammonia plant in Baytown, Texas. The case may set precedent on carbon capture infrastructure regulation.

headline: ExxonMobil Q4 2025 slides: Record production offsets price pressures, earnings decline
summary_text: ExxonMobil reported Q4 and full-year 2025 earnings, highlighting record production that offset price pressures despite earnings decline. The company delivered all ten key projects planned for 2025, expected to add about $3 billion to 2026 earnings. Exxon plans $20 billion in share buybacks for 2026, maintaining dividends.

headline: Exxon beats Wall Street Q4 target as Permian, Guyana fields take output to 40-year high
summary_text: ExxonMobil beat Wall Street Q4 earnings targets driven by higher oil production in the Permian Basin and Guyana fields, reaching a 40-year output high. The company plans to grow 2026 production to 4.9 million boepd and continue $20 billion share repurchases. Dividends paid totaled $17.2 billion in 2025.

headline: Exxon Mobil (XOM) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary_text: Golden Pass LNG project was mechanically completed in Q4 2025 with commissioning underway and first LNG production expected in early March 2026. ExxonMobil deployed lightweight proppant technology in 25% of new wells in 2025, targeting 50% by end of 2026. The company aims for higher structural earnings and lower breakevens.

headline: ExxonMobil Announces 2025 Results
summary_text: ExxonMobil declared a Q1 2026 dividend of $1.03 per share and completed $20 billion in share repurchases in 2025, planning the same for 2026. Cash capital expenditures were $29 billion in 2025 with guidance of $27-$29 billion for 2026. Shareholder distributions totaled $37.2 billion in 2025.

headline: ExxonMobil to Release Fourth Quarter 2025 Financial Results
summary_text: ExxonMobil announced its Q4 2025 financial results release date and updated its Corporate Plan through 2030. Gregory C. Garland was elected to the board effective November 2025. The company plans to webcast the earnings call and provide supplemental financial data.

headline: ExxonMobil's Top 5 Priorities for 2026
summary_text: ExxonMobil's 2026 priorities: AI-driven subsurface learning for recovery gains; Permian manufacturing mode; scaling lightweight proppant (20% recovery, 2M tons/year); midstream/NGL control via stakes in Bahia, Cowboy Connector; commercialize Proxxima resins, hydrogen, CCS into profitable platforms amid carbon policy.

headline: ExxonMobil Q4 2025 slides: Record production offsets price pressures, earnings decline
summary_text: ExxonMobil reported Q4 2025 earnings with record production offsetting price pressures. Key highlights include delivery of all 10 strategic projects adding $3B to 2026 earnings, $15.1B structural cost savings since 2019, Pioneer integration synergies doubled to $4B, 9M tonnes CO2 contracts via CCS, 2026 upstream production growth to 4.9 Moebd, capex $27-29B, and raised 2030 targets by $5B each without extra spending.

headline: ExxonMobil Announces 2025 Results
summary_text: ExxonMobil announced Q4 2025 earnings of $6.5B, record Upstream production over 40 years at 4.7 Moebd (59% advantaged assets), record refinery throughput, $37.2B shareholder distributions, all 10 key projects delivered adding $3B earnings in 2026, $15.1B cost savings, GHG and flaring reductions achieved. Product Solutions expanded with Singapore Resid Upgrade and tripled Proxxima capacity.

headline: 2025: Taking carbon capture and storage from momentum to impact
summary_text: ExxonMobil's 2025 CCS milestones: portfolio to six customers, ~9 MTA CO2 contracted, expanded to power and methanol industries beyond steel, ammonia, gas processing.

headline: Cyclyx International to be restructured
summary_text: Norway - based chemical recycler Agilyx ASA has agreed to a nonbinding memorandum of understanding to restructure its plastics sorting joint venture, Cyclyx International LLC, with petrochemical industry partners ExxonMobil and LyondellBasell, according to a Feb. 4 announcement. The companies, which operate a Circularity Center in Houston and are building a second in the Dallas-Fort Worth area, will split ownership of those facilities. ExxonMobil and LyondellBasell will own the Houston location, while Agilyx will be the sole owner of the still-in-development Dallas-Fort Worth location. RELATED: Circular ambition. In its own statement, Agilyx says it will assume full ownership of the Cyclyx consortium by March 25 and will keep its 50,000 metric tons-per-year offtake agreement with ExxonMobil, with the potential to add volume in the future.

headline: ExxonMobil Buys Guyana FPSO for $2.3B, SBM Offshore Keeps Ops Role
summary_text: SBM Offshore and ExxonMobil Guyana, an affiliate of ExxonMobil, have completed the transaction related to the purchase of One Guyana floating production, storage and offloading (FPSO) unit.

headline: ExxonMobil ceases production at Fife ethylene plant
summary_text: ExxonMobil ceases production at Fife ethylene plant. This news was first announced on the BBC: https: //www.bbc.com/news/articles/cvg1jv77vy8o. Production has ceased at ExxonMobil ’ s Mossmorran chemical works in Fife after the company said the plant was losing around £1 million a week. The Fife Ethylene Plant, which has operated for more than 40 years, permanently shut down on February 2 and will now be fully decommissioned, with the process expected to be completed by early 2028. The closure puts around 400 jobs at risk, affecting workers in manufacturing as well as construction, repair and maintenance roles.

headline: Sintana resolves VMM-37 arbitration with ExxonMobil for $9 million
summary_text: TORONTO - Sintana Energy Inc. (TSXV: SEI, AIM: SEI, OTCQX: SEUSF) announced Wednesday it has reached an agreement with ExxonMobil to settle an ongoing arbitration related to the VMM-37 block in Colombia's Middle Magdalena Valley Basin. Under the settlement terms, Sintana's subsidiaries, Patriot Energy Oil and Gas Inc. and Patriot Energy Sucursal Colombia, will conditionally assign all rights and interests in the VMM-37 block to ExxonMobil. In exchange, ExxonMobil will make two cash payments totaling $ 9 million to Patriot. The first payment of $ 3 million is due within 60 days of the agreement's execution. The second payment of $ 6 million will be made upon approval of the assignment by Colombian governmental agencies, including the Agencia Nacional de Hidrocarburos, and fulfillment of other contractual requirements.

headline: ExxonMobil Earnings: Continued Execution, on Track for 2030 Targets
summary_text: ExxonMobil XOM reported fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of $ 7.3 billion, slightly above market expectations. Earnings fell from the prior year as lower oil prices offset the benefits of higher volumes and stronger refining margins. It delivered 10 projects with an annual earnings capacity of $ 3 billion. Why it matters: Exxon's investment thesis rests on the combination of the addition of high-margin volumes combined with structural cost reductions to deliver 2030 earnings growth targets. Despite the year-over-year decline in earnings, Exxon continued to deliver on these two elements, which leaves it on track for greater future earnings capacity and delivery of those targets.

headline: Details on the timetable of the simplified tender offer on North Atlantic Energies shares
summary_text: Paris, FRANCE - January 30, 2026 - North Atlantic France SAS ("North Atlantic France") refers to its acquisition from ExxonMobil France Holding SAS ("ExxonMobil") of ExxonMobil's entire stake in North Atlantic Energies (formerly, Esso Société Anonyme Française SA) ("North Atlantic Energies") , representing 82.89 % of North Atlantic Energies' share capital and voting rights.

headline: ExxonMobil touts tech to cut Venezuela oil costs
summary_text: New York, 30 January (Argus) - ExxonMobil says it has the technology to bring down the costs of producing Venezuela's difficult-to-process crude if the conditions are right to return to the South American nation. Chief executive officer Darren Woods, who provoked the ire of US president Donald Trump earlier this month after he said Venezuela was currently "uninvestable", said Friday the company could lean into its experience in tapping heavy-crude resources in Canada. " We bring an advantaged approach that will lead to lower-cost production, higher recovery and therefore more economic barrels onto the marketplace ," Woods told analysts after reporting fourth-quarter results. " That's the opportunity set for us that will play out, maybe, over time ." While Woods has said that there needs to be clarity around fiscal and legal terms before ExxonMobil would be prepared to return to Venezuela, he said the Trump administration is taking the right approach to tackling these challenges and that they will get resolved over time.

headline: ExxonMobil Q4 2025 slides: Record production offsets price pressures, earnings decline
summary_text: ExxonMobil (NYSE: XOM) reported fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 earnings on January 30, 2026, highlighting operational achievements despite challenging market conditions. The oil giant posted Q4 earnings of $ 6.5 billion, down from $ 7.5 billion in the previous quarter, with full-year earnings reaching $ 28.8 billion compared to $ 33.7 billion in 2024. Despite beating analyst expectations with Q4 EPS of $ 1.71 versus the projected $ 1.68, ExxonMobil's stock dipped 1.73 % in pre-market trading to $ 138.08, reflecting investor caution about the company's outlook amid ongoing price pressures. Quarterly Performance Highlights. ExxonMobil's full-year earnings of $ 28.8 billion ($ 30.1 billion excluding identified items) were driven by its advantaged portfolio, execution excellence, and structural cost savings.

headline: ExxonMobil Profits Dip On Lower Crude Oil Prices
summary_text: ExxonMobil reported a dip in fourth-quarter profits Friday, citing a drop in oil prices that offset the bounce from higher volumes. The US oil giant reported profits of $ 6.5 billion, down 14.6 per cent from the same time last year. Revenues were $ 82.3 billion, down 1.3 per cent. ExxonMobil said it reached production records at the end of 2025 in Guyana and the shale-rich Permian Basin in the United States, part of the company attaining its highest annual oil and natural gas volumes in 40 years. ExxonMobil also pointed to execution success on major capital initiatives, saying it had delivered all 10 major projects planned for 2025.

headline: ExxonMobil begins commercial CCS project with CF industries in Louisiana
summary_text: ExxonMobil begins commercial CCS project with CF industries in Louisiana. ExxonMobil said it has begun commercial operations of carbon capture and storage (CCS) with ammonia producer CF Industries in Louisiana. The project will transport and store up to 2 million tonnes a year (MTPA) of carbon dioxide from CF Industries' Donaldsonville complex, the company said. Carbon capture is a process through which carbon dioxide (CO 2) generated from industrial activity is stored underground. The process has been embraced by oil companies including Chevron, Occidental Petroleum and Talos Energy.

headline: ONGC eyes partnership with ExxonMobil to jointly bid for oil & gas blocks
summary_text: ONGC eyes partnership with ExxonMobil to jointly bid for oil & gas blocks. Panaji: State-run Oil and Natural Gas Corp. (ONGC) is eyeing collaboration with ExxonMobil to jointly bid for India's hydrocarbon blocks in the tenth round of auctions under the Open Acreage Licensing Policy, according to a top executive. " We are in talks with ExxonMobil also. We are looking at possibilities of joint bidding in upcoming OALP rounds ," O.P. Sinha, director exploration at ONGC, said on Wednesday on the sidelines of the India Energy Week 2026.

headline: ExxonMobil expanding its Gulf Coast carbon storage operations
summary_text: ExxonMobil has begun transporting and permanently storing carbon dioxide from the CF Industries ammonia plant in Donaldsonville, marking a major expansion of its carbon capture and storage footprint on the Gulf Coast, The Center Square writes. The company is using an existing pipeline to move up to 2 million metric tons of CO2 annually from CF Industries to its Rose Carbon Capture and Storage Hub in east Texas, recently approved by the EPA for underground injection. The project is part of a broader build-out that includes multiple new Louisiana facilities coming online in 2026, as well as agreements with steel, natural gas and industrial gas producers. ExxonMobil says its low-carbon solutions unit has now contracted to handle roughly 9 million metric tons of CO2 per year across six customers. The expansion underscores growing industrial demand for certified low-carbon fuels and materials, even as ExxonMobil simultaneously scales back overall low-carbon capital spending and shifts more investment toward traditional oil, gas and LNG assets.

headline: ExxonMobil Doubles Down on Carbon Capture and Storage
summary_text: ExxonMobil is doubling down on carbon capture and storage (CCS) along the U.S. Gulf Coast, laying out a faster ramp in project activity after a milestone-heavy 2025 that moved the company from contracting into operations. The company's Low Carbon Solutions unit is positioning CCS as a practical decarbonization lever for heavy industry at a time when manufacturers are facing intensifying emissions pressure without any easing in demand for energy-intensive products. The Gulf Coast - one of the world's densest corridors of refineries, petrochemicals, gas processing, and heavy manufacturing - remains the center of gravity for ExxonMobil's buildout. The push follows a year in which ExxonMobil says it started up its first commercial CCS project, transporting and storing up to 2 million metric tons per year of CO ? from CF Industries' Donaldsonville complex in Louisiana.

headline: Few refineries report problems as deep cold seizes U.S. Gulf Coast
summary_text: ExxonMobil said it was shutting units at its Baytown, Texas, petrochemical complex on the east side of Houston, because of the freezing weather. Temperatures in Baytown are at 26 degrees Fahrenheit (minus 4 Celsius) , according to data from AccuWeather.com. Exxon did not identify which units were shut at the complex, which includes a chemical plant, olefins plant, ethane cracker and the 564,440 barrel-per-day (bpd) refinery.

headline: KazMunayGas, ExxonMobil Review Cooperation and Exploration Plans
summary_text: KazMunayGas, ExxonMobil Review Cooperation and Exploration Plans. ASTANA - KazMunayGas (KMG) Chair Askhat Khassenov met with ExxonMobil Senior Vice President Peter Larden on Jan. 26 to review the current status of cooperation and plans for key partnership areas. The talks covered prospects for collaboration in geological exploration, oil transportation and the introduction of innovative production technologies. Under a confidentiality agreement between the companies, ExxonMobil is currently conducting an in-depth study of promising exploration areas in Kazakhstan, reported the KMG's press service. Khassenov emphasized that deep expertise in exploration and production is key to assessing the potential of subsoil resources.

headline: ExxonMobil studies prospective exploration blocks in Kazakhstan
summary_text: Today, our companies are working productively across all key areas, and we are confident that this mutually beneficial cooperation will continue to strengthen ," Khassenov said. The sides also discussed the development of additional export routes for Kazakhstan's crude oil. KazMunayGas and ExxonMobil signed a cooperation agreement in September 2025 in the field of new technologies in the oil and gas sector. The document provides a framework for joint work on the introduction of advanced technological solutions across upstream and related segments of the industry. Stay up-to-date with more news on Trend News Agency's WhatsApp channel.

headline: ExxonMobil breaks ground on Baytown site
summary_text: ExxonMobil has officially broken ground on its highly anticipated Baytown Refinery Reconfiguration Project, marking a pivotal shift in its downstream strategy. The expansion at the massive Texas complex is designed to significantly ramp up production of high-value Group III lubricant base stocks and ultra-low sulfur diesel (ULSD) , moving the energy giant away from traditional gasoline-heavy production. As global markets transition toward specialized industrial fluids and cleaner-burning transportation fuels, this investment positions ExxonMobil to capture the growing demand for the high-performance products required by modern, high-efficiency engines and heavy industry. The immediate implications of this groundbreaking are significant for both the Gulf Coast economy and global supply chains. By adding approximately 8,000 barrels per day (BPD) of Group III base stock capacity, ExxonMobil is addressing a long-standing supply deficit in North America, which has historically relied on imports from the Middle East and Asia for these essential synthetic-grade oils.

headline: CPC Crude Prices Plummet Amid Black Sea Drone Strikes News
summary_text: LONDON/MOSCOW, Jan 16 (( Reuters) ) - Offer prices for Caspian CPC Blend crude oil dropped sharply this week, according to trade sources, as exports of the grade continue to be impacted by drone strikes in the Black Sea and weather-related delays. ExxonMobil's Recent Offers. ExxonMobil, which is a shareholder in the Caspian Pipeline Consortium, was offering on Thursday a 120,000 metric ton CPC Blend cargo at a $ 1.35 a barrel discount to benchmark dated Brent in the Platts window, a service run by oil-index publisher S & P Global Commodity Insights, trade sources said. Kazakhstan's Call for Support. No buyers stepped forward and the offer was withdrawn.

headline: Advancing Innovation with Sustainable Foaming Technologies
summary_text: Advancing Innovation with Sustainable Foaming Technologies. A collaboration to advance sustainable manufacturing through innovative foaming technologies continues to focus on the growing demand for lightweight, high-performance, and environmentally friendly materials. The partnership between ExxonMobil Signature Polymers, global recycling systems leader Erema, foam injection molding innovator Moxietec LLC, and injection molding machine manufacturer Engel continues an initiative that also focuses on leveraging advanced foaming technologies to create solutions for industries such as construction, automotive, and packaging. Erema's recycling systems play a key role in the process, converting a mixed stream of 95 % polypropylene (PP) rigids and 5 % polyethylene (PE) film into high-quality pellets. These pellets serve as the foundation for Moxietec's foam technology, which produces lightweight locking blocks for construction applications.

headline: ExxonMobil Defies Gravity: Q4 Earnings Beat Estimates Amidst Slumping Crude - FinancialContent
summary_text: ## A Wider Significance: The 2026 Energy Paradox ExxonMobil’s performance is a microcosm of a broader industry trend: the decoupling of production growth from price stability. For decades, a drop in oil prices led to an immediate pullback in capital spending and production. Today, thanks to technological advancements and massive consolidation, the majors are able to pump more oil for less money. This has created a global surplus of 2–4 million barrels per day, prompting OPEC+ to announce a "strategic pause" in production hikes for the first quarter of 2026 to prevent a total price collapse. [...] This situation poses a regulatory and policy challenge. headline: Borouge Q4 2025 slides: Record production drives profit growth amid market softness
summary_text: Abu Dhabi Polymers Co Borouge LLC (ADX: BOROUGE) presented its Q4 and full-year 2025 results on February 4, 2026, highlighting record operational performance despite challenging market conditions in the global polyolefins industry. The company maintained its position as one of the most profitable players in the sector, with industry-leading margins and strong cash generation supporting its dividend policy. Trading at $ 2.41 per share, Borouge's stock has remained stable following the results announcement, reflecting investor confidence in the company's strategic direction despite some year-over-year profit declines. Quarterly Performance Highlights. Borouge delivered exceptional operational performance in Q4 2025, achieving record production and sales volumes that helped offset softer benchmark pricing in the polyolefins market.

headline: Borouge completes AI proof of concept in Ruwais
summary_text: Jim Masso, President and CEO of Honeywell Process Automation, commented: "Our collaboration with Borouge demonstrates how AI-enabled autonomous operations can be deployed safely and effectively in a live production environment. This milestone highlights the potential of advanced connected solutions to deliver meaningful improvements in efficiency, reliability and operational performance at scale ." Looking ahead. The Borouge-Honeywell partnership was announced in June last year, with the former's AIDT programme working to set new standards in operations, innovation and business performance. Looking ahead, Borouge will advance work to further demonstrate the potential of autonomous operations and assess opportunities to scale the technology across its Ruwais facilities.

headline: Borealis and Borouge Launch Global Brand for Mechanically Recycled Polyolefins
summary_text: Borealis and Borouge have unveiled Recleo, a new global brand designed to streamline access to mechanically recycled polyolefins (PO) for a range of applications. The Recleo portfolio consolidates post-industrial (PIR) and post-consumer (PCR) recyclates and compounds into a cost-effective and versatile material suited for mobility, building and construction, appliance, infrastructure, and consumer products, said the news release. Recleo complements the Borcycle M portfolio of premium mechanically recycled polyolefins derived from post-consumer waste for demanding applications. Together, these brands deliver high-quality circular solutions tailored to diverse customer needs, said Borealis and Borouge. Portfolio aligns with emerging EU regulations.

headline: Hidden Gem: Market Leader stock in Polymer Compounds Manufacturing to Keep on Your Radar - Trade Brains
summary_text: ## Market Positioning The company stands out as India’s largest listed polymer compounds manufacturer, offering over 200 compounds across 5 manufacturing facilities and exporting to 55+ countries. Installed capacity stood at 238,400 MTPA as of September 2025, with expansion underway through new PVC and HFFR facilities to support rising domestic and global demand. Capacity additions are progressing steadily, with a 15,000 MTPA PVC unit commissioned in October 2025 and another 15,000 MTPA scheduled by the end of CY25 mentioned in the recent filing. Management expects installed capacity to exceed 270,000 MTPA by H2 exit. Planned FY26 capex of ~ Rs 110 crore, alongside a broader Rs 300 crore program, reflects an aggressive growth and scale-up strategy. [...] ## Financial & Other Highlights The company posted a stable performance in Q2FY26, with revenue growing 17% year-on-year to Rs 680 crore compared with Rs 580 crore in the same quarter last year. headline: Global oil refining profits surge and may stay strong - Oil & Gas 360
summary_text: Europe remains structurally short diesel, and recent regional refinery closures will exacerbate import requirements, the IEA highlighted. Morgan Stanley said in a report they expect European diesel cracks to hold above $27 a barrel over the next six months – higher than they have been for most of the time since early 2024, according to LSEG data. In the U.S., margins have also hit highs. U.S. diesel margins widened to $49.12 a barrel on Tuesday, the highest since October 2023. ### Share: ##### Goldman Sachs: oil prices to drop to $53 in 2026 ##### UBS expects Brent crude to be trading at this level at the end of 2025 ##### Kazakhstan drags big oil to Swiss court in $166 billion lawsuit ##### Oil prices steady after steep losses in previous session [...] ##### Oil gains almost 2% as Russian port suspends oil exports after Ukrainian attack Linkedin X-twitter Facebook Youtube ## Premium Content • Valuation Dashboards • Marketwatch Stock Data • Earnings & Events •

headline: ERJ Business Briefing - European Rubber Journal
summary_text: Titan International Inc. has completed a strategic partnership with Brazilian wheel maker Rodaros Industria de Rodas Ltda, following regulatory approval, the company said 28 Oct. The partnership includes an initial $4m investment for a 20% stake, with commitments to acquire the remaining 80% in 2029. Rodaros is claimed to be the second-largest agricultural wheel manufacturer in Brazil. Read more Nexen Tire has opened its first brand shops in Bahrain and Kuwait, expanding its retail footprint in the Middle East. The new shops marks “a significant milestone” in the Korean tire maker’s push to expand its retail presence in emerging markets, including the Middle East, South America, and southeast Asia. Read more [...] US infrastructure investment firm I Squared Capital is to acquire Liberty Tire Recycling from Energy Capital Partners – owner since 2021. summary_text: Sigma Lithium announced the sale of 100,000 tonnes of high purity lithium fines at a higher price than previous sales. The company confirmed that mining remobilization activities are proceeding as planned, expected to conclude in January 2026, and denied inaccurate media reports about operational injunctions. This reflects strategic moves to stabilize operations amid regulatory scrutiny.

headline: Sigma Lithium sells 100,000t fines, secures funding | SGML Stock News
summary_text: Sigma Lithium sold 100,000 tonnes of high-purity lithium fines generating approximately $11 million, supporting its mine remobilization efforts. The company signed a working capital agreement for 70,500 tonnes of monthly sales capacity through 2026 and is advancing Mine 1 remobilization to increase safety and capacity, targeting completion in January 2026.

headline: Sigma Lithium waste piles deemed safe in Brazil | SGML Stock News
summary_text: Brazil’s mining regulator ANM found no serious or imminent risk at Sigma Lithium’s waste piles and no legal basis to shut operations, supporting the company’s ramp-up plans. This follows a labor inspection and ongoing enquiry with no material impact, countering misinformation that caused share price volatility.

headline: Sigma Lithium (SGML) Downgraded by BofA Amid Operational Concerns
summary_text: Bank of America downgraded Sigma Lithium stock to Underperform due to unresolved operational and liquidity challenges, including unclear timelines for mining resumption and cash receipt from prepayments. Despite a modest price target increase to $13, the downgrade reflects caution on the company’s near-term prospects amid ongoing issues.

headline: Sigma Lithium's 3Q 25 Results: Increase in Revenues and Cash Position
summary_text: Sigma Lithium reported a 69% quarter-over-quarter and 36% year-over-year increase in net revenue, driven by better sales volumes and strategic commercial partnerships. Mining operations are expected to restart by end of November 2025 and ramp up fully by Q1 2026 with upgraded equipment, reflecting positive financial performance and operational progress.

headline: Sigma Lithium rebounds on new sales, Brazil denial - The Northern Miner
summary_text: Sigma has yet to respond to MINING.COM’s request for comment. Shares of the company surged 17% to C$2.26 in Canadian trading Friday afternoon following the update, taking them back into positive territory for the year. Sigma’s market capitalization now stands at about C$2.3 billion ($1.6 billion). ## Operation updates Sigma also said Friday it had made an additional sale of 100,000 tonnes in high-purity lithium fines at the market price, which has risen since the last sale. Additionally, the lithium miner said remobilization activities at its Brazilian mine site are proceeding as planned and expected to conclude this month. headline: Sigma Lithium restarts Brazilian operations - Mining.com.au
summary_text: Sigma’s 1.5 million tonne per annum mining and industrial processing operation has a nameplate capacity of 270,000 tonnes of lithium concentrate. The plant was commissioned and began commercial operations in 2023. The facility comprises a three-stage crushing circuit, a dense media separation plant, and a water reclamation/dry-stacking unit. Sigma Lithium is a lithium producer focused on supporting a sustainable energy future by empowering growth in the electric battery industry. summary_text: 10.12.2025 • Topics # Chemicals for the 21st Century ## Despite setbacks and skepticism, the renewables journey shows that aligning business and environmental sustainability remains possible, even amid economic headwinds and shifting global dynamics. In the current climate, most senior executives don’t wake up thinking that they must urgently turn their business model around and suddenly become “green”. In fact, the word green has become a bit of a cliché and one could argue that any significant change has been in rhetoric rather than substance. Some companies have even publicly rescinded their stated environmental goals or kept quiet about the benefits to appeal to growing populism and cynicism relating to environmental sustainability. summary_text: Gil Bar-Nahum painted a vivid picture of resurgence: “October alone saw $40 billion returned to investors through M&A, and 35 follow-on transactions compared to none in April.” Mutual funds, flush with capital, are deploying aggressively, sometimes after mere minutes of diligence. The XBI biotech ETF has climbed 20% in recent weeks, signalling renewed confidence. IPO activity, while cautious, is stirring – Jefferies recently led a $250 million IPO for MapLight, with more deals queued. This rebound matters beyond Wall Street. As Bar-Nahum explained, “Follow-ons need to work, IPOs need to work – then purse strings open for venture capital.” In short, public market liquidity is the tide that lifts all boats, eventually cascading into private funding and early-stage innovation. headline: India ramps up Net Zero drive with new tech alliances - Manufacturing Today India
summary_text: Skip to content Manufacturing Today India Posted inEnergy & Power # India ramps up Net Zero drive with new tech alliances Its heat recovery and high condensing performance boost sustainable manufacturing, supporting India’s economic competitiveness and Net Zero goals. by Staff Writer SHARE FBTWLNMAILLN India’s ambition to achieve Net Zero is gaining strong momentum as policymakers, industry leaders, scientists and global technology innovators come together to advance energy efficiency. At the Energy Efficiency Movement (EEM) forum held in Pune, experts highlighted how breakthrough technologies, partnerships and clean-energy solutions could accelerate India’s shift to sustainable industrial growth. Could collaboration be the strongest catalyst for India’s climate goals? headline: Paradeep Phosphates steadies growth on higher volumes and NPK strength - Manufacturing Today India
summary_text: For the nine-month period, performance gained further momentum. Revenue climbed 34 per cent to ₹17,124 crore, and EBITDA increased 45 per cent to ₹1,817 crore. Net profit for 9M FY26 reached ₹841 crore, 71 per cent higher than the previous year, highlighting improving operational efficiency and better product mix. ### Volumes rise on NPK strength Operational metrics remained robust. Q3 production rose 13 per cent to 10 lakh tonnes, while sales volumes increased to 10.70 lakh tonnes. Over nine months, production reached 28.60 lakh tonnes, up 15.4 per cent, and sales stood at 33.66 lakh tonnes, a 16.9 per cent increase. [...] Growth was driven largely by value-added NPK grades. NPK sales rose 30 per cent in 9M to 17.51 lakh tonnes, while TSP sales more than doubled to 2.43 lakh tonnes. The company managed to sustain margins despite global volatility in raw material prices and currency fluctuations, supported by stronger supply chain management and sourcing efficiencies. ### Backward i

headline: 18 new prospecting agencies notified to boost India's coal sector - ANI News
summary_text: हिंदी खबर Representative Image (File Photo/ANI) # 18 new prospecting agencies notified to boost India's coal sector ANI | Updated: Nov 28, 2025 14:36 IST ANI News Join our Whatsapp channel [...] ### Tags Coal exploration Prospecting agencies India coal sector Aatmanirbhar bharat Mines act 1957 Coal blocks Exploration ecosystem Energy needs [...] New Delhi [India], November 28 (ANI): In a major move to accelerate coal exploration and strengthen India's push toward Aatmanirbhar Bharat, the Government of India has expanded the pool of Accredited Prospecting Agencies. On 26 November 2025, under the second proviso to sub-section (1) of Section 4 of the Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act, 1957, private entities accredited by the Quality Council of India National Accreditation Board for Education and Training (QCI-NABET) were officially notified as authorized agencies for prospecting operations.

headline: Driving sustainable practices in manufacturing - Machinery Market
summary_text: Renewable energy adoption Reshoring is another trend gaining momentum. Encouraging UK production not only supports local economies but also delivers environmental benefits by reducing transportation emissions. Producing goods closer to where they are consumed cuts reliance on carbon-intensive global supply chains and strengthens the UK’s commitment to ‘net zero’. Renewable energy adoption is also accelerating, with manufacturers increasingly turning to wind, solar and hydro power. Significant investment in offshore wind, carbon capture and hydrogen technologies promises even greater progress in the years ahead. headline: Smurfit Westrock to Cut 90 Jobs Amid Cost Pressures
summary_text: The company will reduce its workforce by 90 jobs across two Canadian facilities as part of cost-cutting measures and to strengthen its solid bleached sulphate portfolio. This move reflects ongoing efforts to optimize operations amid market pressures.

headline: A Deep-Dive into Smurfit Westrock (NYSE: SW) in 2026
summary_text: Smurfit Westrock has successfully navigated integration challenges post-merger, emerging as a global leader in sustainable packaging. The company is focused on operational improvements and benefits from near-shoring trends in Mexico. It maintains a strong balance sheet with a Net Debt/EBITDA ratio of 2.1x and is speculated to increase dividends or initiate share buybacks in 2026.

headline: Smurfit Westrock partners with SLR and RIZM to accelerate net zero transition across its European recycled paper mills
summary_text: Smurfit Westrock is collaborating with environmental consultancy SLR and energy specialists RIZM to develop site-specific net zero transition plans for its European recycled paper mills. This initiative aims to mitigate EU-ETS costs and future-proof the company's energy transition amid evolving market and policy conditions.

headline: Smurfit Westrock Shares Up 8.3% Following Dividend Announcement
summary_text: Following the announcement of a quarterly dividend increase, Smurfit Westrock's shares rose by 8.3%. The dividend represents a $1.81 annualized payout with a yield of 4.1%, reflecting investor confidence in the company's financial health.

headline: Smurfit Westrock Declares Quarterly Dividend
summary_text: The company announced a quarterly dividend of $0.4523 per share payable on March 18, 2026, reflecting its strong financial position and commitment to shareholder returns. Shareholders can elect to receive dividends in Pounds Sterling or Euro.

headline: Smurfit Westrock Secures Global Recognition in Fortune’s 2026 Most Admired Companies
summary_text: Smurfit Westrock was named to Fortune's World's Most Admired Companies 2026 list, ranking second among packaging firms. This recognition highlights the company's leadership, sustainability commitment, and innovation in the global packaging sector.

headline: Smurfit Westrock to Announce 2025 Fourth Quarter and Full Year Results with Medium-Term Investor Update on February 11, 2026
summary_text: Smurfit Westrock plans to release its Q4 and full-year 2025 financial results along with a medium-term strategic update covering capital allocation and value drivers. The event will be held on February 11, 2026, and streamed for global investors.

headline: Smurfit Westrock Wins 15 WorldStar Awards for Green Packaging Excellence
summary_text: The company won 15 WorldStar Awards recognizing its innovative and sustainable paper-based packaging solutions. This achievement reinforces Smurfit Westrock's global leadership in packaging innovation and sustainability.

headline: Smurfit Westrock among firms subject to €400m Italian ‘cartel’ lawsuit
summary_text: Smurfit Westrock is involved in ongoing legal proceedings in Milan related to a €124 million fine imposed in 2019 for cartel activities. The company faces lawsuits from purchasers of corrugated sheets and boxes but has not commented on the ongoing cases.

headline: Smurfit Westrock to Close Paper Machine at La Tuque
summary_text: Smurfit Westrock announces permanent closure of a paper machine at La Tuque, Quebec mill (127,000 tons SBS capacity) and extrusion facility in Pointe-aux-Trembles due to scale and cost challenges, impacting ~90 employees. Aims to strengthen SBS portfolio and align with market conditions.

headline: Earnings Preview For Smurfit WestRock
summary_text: Preview of Smurfit WestRock's Q4 2025 earnings on Feb 11, 2026, with expected EPS of $0.49. Highlights 4.33% revenue growth as of Sep 2025, strong net margin (3.07%), ROE (1.34%), ROA (0.54%), and debt-to-equity (0.77). Post-merger leader in containerboard.

headline: Smurfit Westrock announces permanent closure of a paper machine at La Tuque mill
summary_text: Official announcement of permanent closure of one paper machine at La Tuque mill (127,000 tons SBS) and Pointe-aux-Trembles extrusion facility due to cost challenges. Workforce reduction of ~90, with support measures. Strengthens long-term competitiveness.

headline: Smurfit-Westrock to Announce 2025 Fourth Quarter and Full Year Results together with a Medium-Term investor update on February 11, 2026
summary_text: Smurfit Westrock plc plans to release its Q4 and full year 2025 financial results and a Medium-Term Plan update on February 11, 2026, including capital allocation priorities and value drivers. A quarterly dividend of $0.4523 per share is payable March 18, 2026, with a live presentation at NYSE.

headline: A closer look at Smurfit Westrock's new alternative to HDPE bottles
summary_text: Smurfit Westrock's new Bag-in-Box Powergrip replaces HDPE bottles and jerrycans, using less material and cutting production costs, advancing sustainable packaging innovations.

headline: What is Growth Strategy and Future Prospects of WestRock
summary_text: WestRock's growth strategy emphasizes sustainability, fiber-based plastic replacements, automation for customer lock-in, M&A in specialty packaging, and innovations in smart factories, recyclable materials, AI, and partnerships for plastic-to-paper transitions.

headline: Smurfit Westrock to close Quebec paper machine amid cost challenges
summary_text: Smurfit Westrock to close Quebec paper machine amid cost challenges.

headline: Smurfit Westrock announces $0.4523 quarterly dividend
summary_text: DUBLIN - Smurfit Westrock plc (NYSE: SW, LSE: SWR) announced Tuesday that its Board has approved a quarterly dividend of $ 0.4523 per ordinary share, payable on March 18, 2026, to shareholders of record as of February 17, 2026. The packaging giant currently offers a 4.12 % dividend yield with an annual payout of $ 1.72 per share, according to InvestingPro data. February 17 will also serve as the ex-dividend date, according to the company's statement. The default payment currency will be U.S. Dollar for shareholders who hold their ordinary shares through a Depository Trust Company participant or in registered form. Shareholders holding registered shares can elect to receive payment in an alternative currency by registering with the company's Transfer Agent, Computershare Trust Company N.A., by February 13, 2026.

summary_text: "Optical sensors cannot detect carbon-black plastics." Plastics that include carbon black — a fine, black powder added during manufacturing to color, strengthen, shield from sunlight, and sometimes make the material conduct electricity. Think of it like adding tiny black grains to dough that change the cookie’s color and texture while making it hold together better and resist heat. Investors care because using carbon black affects product performance, cost, regulatory compliance, recyclability, and demand in industries like automotive, electronics and packaging. composite materials technical "Composite materials break classification logic entirely." headline: International Paper’s Strategic Moves and Financial Forecasts Ignite Market Interest
summary_text: International Paper projects a 2026 adjusted EBITDA of $3.5 to $3.7 billion, reflecting positive earnings outlook despite recent operational challenges. The company is undergoing a strategic breakup into two independent companies focusing on distinct regional markets, supporting investor confidence and financial discipline.

headline: International Paper to split into two companies
summary_text: International Paper announced plans to split into two independent, publicly traded companies, separating its North American operations from its European packaging business. This strategic move aims to streamline operations and boost productivity amid a weak global economy. The European entity will combine legacy DS Smith and International Paper assets and is expected to list on the London Stock Exchange.

headline: International Paper to Create Two Independent Public Companies and Reports Full-Year and Fourth Quarter 2025 Results
summary_text: International Paper announced its plan to create two independent publicly traded companies: one focusing on North America and the other on EMEA packaging businesses. The company completed the sale of its Global Cellulose Fibers business for $1.5 billion and expects to deliver $3.5 to $3.7 billion of adjusted EBITDA in 2026.

headline: International Paper to split into two separate companies
summary_text: International Paper will spin off its European packaging business into a new publicly traded company, while the North American operations will continue under the International Paper name. The split aims to sharpen focus on regional markets and improve operational efficiency following the $7.2 billion acquisition of DS Smith.

headline: International Paper to split into two companies | Packaging Dive
summary_text: International Paper announced the spin-off of its EMEA packaging business into a separate publicly traded company, following its acquisition of DS Smith. The separation is expected to accelerate cost optimization and innovation, with restructuring costs anticipated in 2026.

headline: International Paper sells pulp unit for $1.5B
summary_text: International Paper completed the sale of its Global Cellulose Fibers business to American Industrial Partners for $1.5 billion, receiving preferred stock with an initial liquidation preference of $190 million. This divestiture aligns with the company's strategic focus on sustainable packaging and regional market optimization.

headline: International Paper to close 5 sites, affecting 500 employees
summary_text: As part of its integration with DS Smith, International Paper plans to close five sites in Germany, impacting approximately 500 employees. The closures are expected to occur by the end of 2026 and are part of a broader reorganization to optimize the European footprint and reduce costs.

headline: International Paper Q4 2025 slides: strategic split announced amid mixed results
summary_text: International Paper announced plans to split into two independent public companies: one for North America retaining the IP name, and a new EMEA Packaging Business. Full-year 2025 sales reached $23.6 billion, adjusted EBITDA $3.0 billion, driven by DS Smith acquisition. For 2026, North America forecasts 9-13% EBITDA growth; EMEA targets $1.0-1.1 billion EBITDA after restructuring including 27 site closures and 2,000 headcount reductions. Company plans $400 million investment in EMEA and reaffirms $5 billion EBITDA target by 2027. Stock fell 7.25% initially on earnings miss.

headline: International Paper to split into 2 companies
summary_text: International Paper plans to split into two geography-based companies post-DS Smith acquisition: North American business ($15.2 billion 2025 sales) and EMEA business ($8.5 billion sales) as a spinoff with IP retaining stake, listing on LSE and NYSE. Completion in 12-15 months pending approvals. $400 million investment in EMEA for 2026; overall 2025 loss $2.84 billion. Focus on footprint optimization, cost reduction, and innovation acceleration.

headline: International Paper: Strategic Realignment and Cost Cutting
summary_text: International Paper extends restructuring into 2026 with 7 additional facility closures impacting over 700 positions, focused on EMEA supply chain efficiency, procurement discipline, and cost control. Builds on 2024-2025 actions closing 20 EMEA sites and 1,400 jobs. Aligns with split into two public companies for regional focus.

headline: International Paper creates two new, separate entities
summary_text: International Paper separates into two companies post-DS Smith integration: North America packaging solutions and standalone DS Smith for EMEA (30 countries, $8.5 billion 2025 sales, $800 million EBITDA). Aligns with 80/20 strategy for efficiency, cost reduction, innovation. EMEA targets higher margins via investments; North America expands in industrial/consumer packaging. Recent closures include Texas box plant.

headline: International Paper expects at least 7 closures, 700+ layoffs in 2026
summary_text: International Paper plans 7 EMEA closures and 700+ layoffs in 2026 as part of optimization, smaller scale focusing on supply chain and procurement. Follows 20 EMEA closures and 1,400 cuts in 2025. Ties to company split into NA and EMEA entities, with $400 million EMEA investment. 2025 cost benefits $510 million; 2026 sales outlook $24.1-24.9 billion.

headline: International Paper to Create Two Independent Public Companies and Reports Full-Year and Fourth Quarter 2025 Results
summary_text: International Paper reports 2025 net sales $23.63 billion, $2.84 billion loss. Announces split into two public packaging companies: PS NA and PS EMEA, completing in 12-15 months. Progress on 80/20 strategy with NA EBITDA up 37% YoY; EMEA advancing cost levers for 2026 strength.

headline: American Industrial Partners Completes Acquisition of International Paper's Global Cellulose Fibers Business
summary_text: American Industrial Partners completed acquisition of International Paper's Global Cellulose Fibers (GCF) business on Jan 23, 2026, now independent. GCF leads in fluff pulp with strong facilities and customers, positioned for growth under AIP's operational agenda.

headline: RBC Capital lowers International Paper stock price target to $54
summary_text: In other recent news, International Paper reported its fourth-quarter 2025 earnings, revealing a notable miss on earnings per share (EPS) expectations. The company posted an EPS of - $ 0.08, significantly below the forecasted $ 0.27, resulting in a surprise of -129.63 %. Despite this shortfall, International Paper's revenue exceeded expectations, coming in at $ 6.01 billion compared to the anticipated $ 5.92 billion. In related developments, Wells Fargo upgraded International Paper's stock rating from Underweight to Equal Weight. The firm also raised its price target to $ 40.00 from $ 36.00, citing "step-change improvements" in the company's PSNA operations over the past two years.

headline: IP to spin off non-North American operations

headline: International Paper: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary_text: MEMPHIS, Tenn. (AP) - MEMPHIS, Tenn. (AP) - International Paper Co. (IP) on Thursday reported a loss of $ 2.38 billion in its fourth quarter. On a per-share basis, the Memphis, Tennessee - based company said it had a loss of $ 4.52. Losses, adjusted for non-recurring costs and to account for discontinued operations, came to 8 cents per share. The results fell short of Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of six analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 28 cents per share.

headline: International Paper's Strategic Split: Focus on North America
summary_text: International Paper, accounting for roughly one-third of the North American corrugated packaging market, completed a $ 7.2 billion buyout of London - based rival DS Smith last year and has since shed assets in Europe tied to the deal.

headline: International Paper to split into 2 companies
summary_text: International Paper announced Thursday it plans to split into two independent, publicly traded companies based on geography, following its acquisition of U.K. - based DS Smith in January 2025.

headline: International Paper completes sale of global cellulose fibers business
summary_text: Late last week, International Paper completed the sale of its global cellulose fibers (GCF) business unit to American Industrial Partners (AIP) , a New York City - based private equity firm.

headline: AIP completes acquisition of International Paper's cellulose fiber unit
summary_text: NEW YORK - American Industrial Partners (AIP) announced Friday it has completed the acquisition of International Paper's (NYSE: IP) Global Cellulose Fibers (GCF) business, which will now operate as an independent company.

headline: International Paper completes sale of cellulose fibers unit to AIP for $1.5 billion
summary_text: International Paper completes sale of cellulose fibers unit to AIP for $ 1.5 billion.

headline: AMERICAN INDUSTRIAL PARTNERS COMPLETES ACQUISITION OF INTERNATIONAL PAPER'S GLOBAL CELLULOSE FIBERS BUSINESS
summary_text: NEW YORK, Jan. 23, 2026 /PRNewswire/ - American Industrial Partners ("AIP") , a focused industrials investor, today announced that an affiliate of AIP has completed its acquisition of the Global Cellulose Fibers (GCF) business of International Paper (NYSE: IP; LSE: IPC) .

headline: International Paper Completes Sale of Global Cellulose Fibers Business to American Industrial Partners (AIP)
summary_text: MEMPHIS, Tenn., Jan. 23, 2026 /PRNewswire/ - International Paper (NYSE: IP; LSE: IPC) , a global leader in sustainable packaging solutions, has completed the sale of its Global Cellulose Fibers (GCF) business to funds affiliated with American Industrial Partners (AIP) .

headline: International Paper Declares Quarterly Dividend
summary_text: MEMPHIS, Tenn., Jan. 16, 2026 /PRNewswire/ - International Paper (NYSE: IP; LSE: IPC) today declared a quarterly dividend of $ 0.4625 per share for the period from January 1, 2026 to March 31, 2026, inclusive, on the common stock, par value $ 1.00, of the Company, payable on March 17, 2026, to holders of record at the close of business on February 23, 2026. Today, the Company also declared a quarterly dividend of $ 1.00 per share for the period from January 1, 2026 to March 31, 2026, inclusive, on the cumulative $ 4.00 preferred stock of the Company, payable on March 17, 2026, to holders of record at the close of business on February 23, 2026. About International Paper.

headline: World Bank backs Malaysia paper maker with US$70m for sustainable production
summary_text: The funding was extended to XSD International Paper Sdn Bhd (XSD) , a manufacturer of coated duplex board paper and grey board in Malaysia, through the International Finance Corporation (IFC) , the World Bank's private sector arm.

headline: International Paper To Shut Down Two US Packaging Plants
summary_text: International Paper's closing two packaging plants in California and Kentucky by January 2026, affecting 218 jobs, as it looks to streamline costs amid sluggish demand.

summary_text: International Paper to close two U.S. packaging plants amid weak demand.

headline: International Paper Announces Closures of Compton, California and Louisville, Kentucky Packaging Facilities as Part of Strategic Growth Initiative in North America
summary_text: MEMPHIS, Tenn., Nov. 14, 2025 /PRNewswire/ - International Paper (NYSE: IP; LSE: IPC) today announced the closure of its packaging facilities in Compton, California and Louisville, Kentucky.

summary_text: International Paper to close facilities in California, Kentucky.

headline: International Paper to close 5 sites, affecting 500 employees
summary_text: International Paper announced Wednesday it plans to close five sites in Germany as part of its integration with DS Smith, the London - based packaging company it acquired in January for an estimated $ 7.2 billion.

summary_text: John Buckingham The Prudent Speculator This is a market of stocks, not simply a stock market. summary_text: Keeping the customer at the core of everything we do is essential. That means investing in technology, building partnerships and continuing to innovate so that sustainability works at scale. ## Tell us more about the work you've been doing with Coca-Cola and Costco Chris: These partnerships are great examples of customer collaboration driving innovation. With Costco, we’ve recently developed paper-based alternatives to replace plastic handles for their multipack products, taking more than 230 tons of single-use plastic out of the system to date. summary_text: The bull case: A globally scaled consumer-staples leader with deep brands, strong cash generation, and explicit capital return plans—plus guidance that implies steadier earnings than many cyclicals. headline: Inside Dine’s push for value, dual-branded development
summary_text: Dine Brands identified opportunities to develop 900 co-branded Applebee’s and IHOP restaurants nationwide using market data. IHOP introduced a value platform called House Faves with $6-$7 meals, helping it achieve positive traffic growth for the first time in years. The strategy focuses on value marketing and development to drive sales growth and franchisee success.

headline: Dine Brands Shareholders Lost $600M. The Board Lost Nothing
summary_text: Dine Brands experienced a significant financial decline with EBITDA down 21%, net income collapsed 60%, and free cash flow down double digits. Shareholders lost nearly 70% of their value, attributed to poor board governance and empty board seats. The dividend was cut significantly, impacting shareholder income.

headline: Why Dine Brands (DIN) Stock Is Up Today
summary_text: Dine Brands shares rose 5.8% after UBS raised its price target from $21 to $35, despite maintaining a Neutral rating. The company reported a 4.3% increase in same-restaurant sales, indicating healthy consumer spending on dining out. The stock reached a 52-week high at $36.51 per share.

headline: Applebee's parent Dine Brands lays off 9% of workforce
summary_text: Dine Brands laid off about 9% of its corporate staff amid struggles with sales and traffic declines at Applebee’s and IHOP. The layoffs affected multiple departments and offices at the Pasadena, California-based company. This move aligns with industry trends as other restaurant companies also reduce workforce due to rising costs and falling traffic.

headline: Q3 Earnings Roundup: Dine Brands (NYSE:DIN) And The Rest Of The Sit-Down Dining Segment
summary_text: Dine Brands reported steady performance in Q3 with Applebee’s boosting same-store sales for the second consecutive quarter and IHOP’s traffic turning positive. The company operates a franchise model with Applebee’s and IHOP brands. The broader sit-down dining segment showed resilience amid easing inflation and recent interest rate cuts.

headline: APET-Based Thermoformed Trays Market Trends 2025-35
summary_text: APET thermoformed trays market focuses on sustainability with recycled PET, smart packaging features like QR codes and sensors, lightweighting, and customization. In July 2025, Alma Products launched bespoke APET trays for food sectors including bakery and ready meals, aiding regulatory compliance and cost reduction.

headline: Digital folding cartons market set to reach USD 24.3 billion by 2035
summary_text: Digital folding cartons market to hit USD 24.3B by 2035, fueled by personalization, short runs, sustainability, and quick product updates in food packaging (46.7% share). Enables variable data printing, track & trace, reduced waste, and alignment with ESG goals for regulatory and consumer demands.

headline: Tetra Recart targets home-cooking trend with F&B carton innovation
summary_text: Tetra Recart promotes paper-based, heat-treated cartons for soups and sauces, extending shelf life, preserving nutrition, and offering sustainability benefits amid rising home-cooking trends. It provides logistical efficiencies like 20% more units per pallet than cans, cost savings, and addresses supply chain disruptions and consumer demands for convenience and eco-friendliness.

headline: Folding Carton Packaging Market
summary_text: The folding carton packaging market is projected to grow from USD 147.3 billion in 2025 to USD 229.5 billion by 2035 at 4.5% CAGR, driven by food and beverage applications with advanced barrier coatings, regulatory compliance, and sustainability trends like plastic-free solutions and digital printing for customization.

headline: Honggan Packaging chooses HP for flex pack growth

headline: Latest Quarterly China PE Spreads Review: Crisis Continues - ICIS
summary_text: But this was insufficient to compensate for the domestic economic challenges detaile below. Demographics Newly released official figures show China recorded just 7.92 million births in 2025, the lowest since records began in 1949. The birth rate dropped to 5.63 per thousand and the population shrank for the fourth consecutive year, falling to around 1.404–1.405 billion. This deepening demographic contraction poses long‑term challenges for polymer demand across consumer goods, construction and packaging. Property and investment [...] Although plant closures in high‑cost regions such as Europe and South Korea will help rebalance the industry over time, the pace is slow, and the scale of oversupply built during 2019–2023 is vast. My view remains that the market is unlikely to show significant improvement for another three to five years, although as always, I hope to be proven wrong. summary_text: If 2025 taught us anything, it’s that the beauty sector isn’t just about products — it’s about strategic moves. The year closed with a flurry of headline‑grabbing M&A that reshaped portfolios and created new category leaders. From Ulta Beauty’s acquisition of Space NK (rumoured north of £300 million) to E.l.f. Beauty’s $1 billion purchase of Rhode (complete with Hailey Bieber stepping into an executive role), brands big and small found new homes and new growth pathways. Heavyweights like L’Oréal expanded prestige offerings with Medik8 and Color Wow, while legacy portfolios were streamlined — think Unilever’s sale of Kate Somerville and strategic add‑ons like Wild and Dr. Squatch. headline: Lightening the Weight and the ‘Recycling Burden’ at Luxe Pack Monaco 2025 - Beauty Packaging
summary_text: ## SMCG (Somang Glass) Korean manufacturer SMCG (Somang Glass) is a certified supplier for leading global cosmetic companies, including several in the U.S. It operates on quality and sustainability standards. 60% PCR is used in every glass product they produce. SMCG offers a variety of cosmetic components such as caps, pumps, droppers, and more. Customers can choose the thickness and shape of flocked applicators. A wide selection of standard mold stock, with over 400 options, is available. headline: FRITZ! OS 8.20 is now also available for FRITZ! Box 5690 Pro

headline: FRITZ! OS 8.24 available for first FRITZ! Box models

headline: CompoSecure Completes Business Combination with Husky Technologies and Rebrands Corporate Entity to GPGI, Inc.
summary_text: CompoSecure finalized its $7.4 billion merger with Husky Technologies, creating a diversified compounder with two reporting segments: CompoSecure and Husky. The corporate entity was rebranded as GPGI, Inc., reflecting its strategy of investing in companies with strong market positions. Husky retains its brand and operations under the new ownership.

headline: CompoSecure closes $7.4B Husky deal, rebrands as GPGI, Inc.
summary_text: CompoSecure completed its business combination with Husky Technologies, forming GPGI, Inc., a diversified industrial technology compounder with two reporting segments. The merger is expected to deliver over 20% EPS accretion, with Husky maintaining its brand and operational continuity under the new corporate structure.

headline: CompoSecure completes $7.4 billion merger with Husky Technologies
summary_text: CompoSecure finalized its $7.4 billion merger with Husky Technologies and rebranded as GPGI, Inc. The combined company operates with two distinct segments and reported strong Q3 2025 earnings exceeding expectations. The merger received stockholder approval and regulatory clearance, closing in January 2026.

headline: CompoSecure stockholders approve Husky Technologies merger
summary_text: CompoSecure stockholders approved the issuance of shares to facilitate the business combination with Husky Technologies, marking a key step toward closing the merger expected in January 2026. The company also reported Q3 2025 earnings surpassing forecasts, supporting positive investor sentiment for the strategic move.

headline: Husky highlights local commitment and innovations to enable safety, affordability, and sustainability at Plastindia 2026
summary_text: On February 5, 2026, Husky showcased innovations at Plastindia 2026 for safe, affordable, sustainable packaging, highlighting PET preform systems, closures, rPET processing, medical solutions, and Advantage+Elite monitoring. Focus on lowest conversion costs, higher throughput, and local manufacturing in Chennai to address supply chain and sustainability challenges in India.

headline: Research Update: Husky Technologies Ltd. Upgraded
summary_text: On January 14, 2026, CompoSecure completed acquisition of Husky Technologies and repaid all existing debt, leading to a ratings upgrade by S&P Global. This corporate finance event impacts Husky's financial structure post-merger.

headline: CompoSecure Completes Business Combination with Husky Technologies and Rebrands Corporate Entity to GPGI, Inc.
summary_text: Husky Technologies announces the completion of its business combination with CompoSecure on January 12, 2026, rebranding the corporate entity to GPGI, Inc. The deal supports Husky's long-term strategy, emphasizing innovation, operational strength, R&D, and customer partnerships, with no immediate changes to operations. Husky will operate as a distinct segment within GPGI, focusing on sustainability and growth.

headline: CompoSecure completes $7.4 billion merger with Husky Technologies
summary_text: CompoSecure completed its $7.4 billion business combination with Husky Technologies, rebranding to GPGI, Inc., with trading under NYSE:GPGI starting January 23, 2026. The merger features 70% recurring revenues, funded by $2B PIPE, $1B from Platinum Equity, and $2B debt, valuing at 11.6x 2026 pro forma EBITDA. Husky operates as a distinct segment.

headline: Canadian oil export concerns, Mount Milligan extension approved, and artificial intelligence’s growing role in mineral exploration - CIM Magazine
summary_text: A recent report from polling firm Ipsos and VRIFY Technology found that artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning adoption in mineral exploration is growing but uneven. While 56 per cent of respondents reported using AI occasionally and 21 per cent regularly, skepticism of the technology persists, especially among geologists. Key barriers to adoption include budget constraints, unclear return on investment, skills gaps and trust in model outputs. Despite this, most respondents saw near-term benefits, namely faster decision-making and improved efficiency. He also curates the twice-monthly Market Moves Strategy newsletter that showcases Endeavor stories on strategy, leadership and investment and contributes to other Market Moves newsletters. [...] Prior to IndustryWeek, Laura reported on the healthcare industry and covered local news. She was the editor of the Chicago Journal and a staff writer for Cleveland Scene. headline: The Fashion and Beauty Deals That Defined 2025 - Vogue
summary_text: Read More The Vogue Business Funding Tracker By Maliha Shoaib The shakeout in 2025 means that those who were able to thrive under pressure this year are even more attractive. In 2026, experts predict an uptick in M&A activity, especially as tariff noise settles and the luxury market improves. “The stronger the luxury market demand, the more there is interest from investors. As the market turns positive, you see more financial sponsors that are keen to back the sector,” says Mario Ortelli, founder and managing partner at M&A boutique advisory Ortelli & Co. Here are the year’s takeaways from M&A across fashion, beauty, retail and tech. ## Fashion [...] Finally, Frasers Group returned to the M&A landscape, with its acquisition of Miami-based multi-brand retailer The Webster in October. It’s a do-over for Frasers Group, which acquired luxury e-tailer Matches in December 2023 and sent it into administration just four months after. headline: Beyond 'Big and Bulky' - Industrial Distribution
summary_text: “It’s going to be very intentional and very aligned with what we’re trying to do strategically,” she said. Global Industrial also isn’t simply a distributor for its supply partners, either: the company’s private-label lines – Global calls them “Exclusive Brands” – account for more than 40% of its overall sales and represent its fastest-growing sourcing channel. Chaibi, however, said that she doesn’t have a specific goal for those brands in mind; instead, she envisions an offering that will remain a mix of Exclusive Brand products and solutions from its suppliers — all providing more of what its customers really need. summary_text: ## Kering’s Leaked Strategy Memo A strategy memo that was circulated to top Kering executives around the time of new CEO Luca De Meo’s arrival in September was leaked online Tuesday, appearing on Panorama and authored by the group’s long-time adversary Carmine Rotondaro (who helped develop, then blew the whistle on, Italian brands’ once-popular scheme to reduce their tax exposure by shifting activities to Ticino, Switzerland). The memo, of which BoF has since managed to see an official summary as well as the unsanctioned full text, appears to be a lengthy, blunt diagnosis of Kering’s shortcomings across pricing and sell-through, retail networks, speed to market, portfolio management and more. headline: Jindal Poly appeals NCLAT against class action lawsuit
summary_text: Jindal Poly Films has appealed to the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) challenging the NCLT's admission of a class action lawsuit by minority shareholders. The company maintains that the order does not reflect any findings on the allegations and asserts that business decisions were made under commercial wisdom and applicable laws.

headline: Minority shareholders score win as NCLT admits India's first corporate class action suit
summary_text: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) admitted India's first corporate class action suit filed by minority shareholders of Jindal Poly Films alleging asset diversion and undervalued sales causing losses over ₹2,500 crore. The case marks a landmark for minority shareholder activism and corporate governance in India.

headline: Jindal Poly Films NCLT ruling marks rare activation of class action law
summary_text: The NCLT's decision to admit a minority shareholders' class action against Jindal Poly Films has brought renewed focus to Section 245 of the Companies Act, 2013. Jindal Poly Films has appealed the order, maintaining all business decisions were lawful and prudent.

headline: Jindal Poly Films Ltd Hits Intraday High with 7.16% Surge on 6 Feb 2026
summary_text: Jindal Poly Films Ltd's stock surged 7.16% intraday to Rs 432, outperforming its sector amid heightened trading activity. Despite this short-term strength, the company faces longer-term financial challenges with declining sales and negative profitability trends.

headline: NCLT Allows India's First Major Shareholder Class Action Against Jindal Poly Films, ETLegalWorld
summary_text: The NCLT admitted a landmark class action suit by minority shareholders against Jindal Poly Films alleging significant losses due to related-party transactions. The tribunal dismissed Jindal Poly Films' challenge to the suit's maintainability, marking a significant development in shareholder rights in India.

headline: Jindal Poly Films Limited Schedules Board Meeting on December 31, 2025 for Q2FY26 Financial Results
summary_text: Jindal Poly Films Limited announced a board meeting scheduled for December 31, 2025, to review and approve unaudited financial results for Q2FY26 and H1FY26. This is a routine financial update in compliance with SEBI regulations.

headline: Polyethylene Terephthalate Film from India: Notice of Amended Final Results Involving Jindal
summary_text: The US Department of Commerce issued amended final results in the antidumping duty administrative review of PET film from India following a settlement agreement with Jindal on January 28, 2026, after a CIT remand on August 1, 2025, indicating regulatory changes impacting exports.

headline: Jindal Poly Films Appoints Ms. Rashmi Gupta as Company Secretary and Compliance Officer
summary_text: Jindal Poly Films Limited appointed Ms. Rashmi Gupta as Company Secretary and Compliance Officer, designating her as Key Managerial Personnel, effective from a board meeting on February 7, 2026.

headline: Jindal Poly Films Challenges NCLT Order Admitting Class Action Suit
summary_text: Jindal Poly Films appealed to NCLAT against NCLT's February 5, 2026 order admitting a minority shareholder class action suit alleging asset stripping via undervalued related-party transactions worth over Rs 2,268 crore; NCLAT agreed to hear the appeal urgently.

headline: NCLT Admits Class Action Suit by Minority Shareholders Against Jindal Poly Films Over Alleged Related-Party Transactions
summary_text: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) New Delhi admitted India's first substantive shareholder class action under Section 245 against Jindal Poly Films, alleging diversion of over INR 703 crore through undervalued sales of preference shares in Jindal Powertech to promoter-linked entities SSJ Trust and Jindal Poly Investment, causing losses exceeding Rs 2,500 crore; the company plans to appeal.

headline: Jindal Poly Films Reports No Requests for Re-lodgment of Physical Share Transfers in December 2025
summary_text: Jindal Poly Films confirmed zero requests for re-lodgment of physical share transfers in December 2025, as reported by RTA KFin Technologies, in compliance with SEBI circular dated July 2, 2025, relevant for corporate governance and regulatory adherence.

headline: Jindal Poly Films Announces Rs 700 Crore Expansion for BOPP Film Line in India
summary_text: Jindal Poly Films is investing Rs 700 crore (USD 84 million) to add a new BOPP film line in Nashik, Maharashtra, as part of metallized film market expansions focused on recyclable high-barrier BOPP and BOPE films, enhancing product innovation and manufacturing capacity.

headline: Jindal Stainless Q3 FY26 revenue up 6%, PAT rises 27% - Manufacturing Today India
summary_text: ### Focus on domestic growth and regulated exports Managing Director of Jindal Stainless, Abhyuday Jindal, said, “The domestic market, where we see sustained growth and demand, remains our strategic priority, and we will further intensify efforts to expand our footprint across key sectors with a strong emphasis on innovation. We continue to advocate for a robust regulatory framework of standards and QCOs to curb the inflow of substandard imports into the country that risk consumer safety. On the export front, we stay cautiously optimistic. Operational Risks: The company relies on a small group of key customers for a significant portion of its sales, and any loss of these customers could impact financial results. Additionally, the company faces risks related to supply chain disruptions, particularly from single-source or limited-source suppliers. Regulatory Risks: Compliance with stringent environmental, health, and safety laws imposes significant costs. headline: Saint-Gobain: Boosting India's Manufacturing Capabilities - Procurement Magazine
summary_text: ## Strategic acquisitions and projects Alongside investments, Saint-Gobain has been acquiring businesses in India since it entered the region. Its 1996 acquisition of Grindwell Norton was its first entry in the market, which was followed by the acquisition of a majority equity stake in what is now Saint-Gobain Sekurit. Winter Misra Diamond Tools and the Fused Refractories business of Carborundum Universal were acquired in 1998 and 2002 respectively. British Plaster Board was next in 2005, before the Bonded Abrasives business of Orient Abrasives in 2006. A float plant near Bharuch, Gujarat was acquired from Sezal Architecture Glass in 2011 and a variety of new plants were commissioned in 2012. headline: Global PE deals for November 18, 2025 - PitchBook
summary_text: Warburg Pincus and Permira are considering an acquisition of NYSE-listed Clearwater Analytics, a developer of accounting software with a current market value of around $5.6 billion, Bloomberg reported. Thoma Bravo has also made an offer for the company, Reuters reported. SK Capital Partners and Lone Star are among those interested in an acquisition of Switzerland-based drug distribution business Swixx Biopharma, which could be valued at up to €2 billion in a deal, Bloomberg reported. Clearlake Capital agreed to sell Concert Golf Partners, which operates private golf clubs, to Bain Capital. The deal values Concert Golf at over $1.3 billion, Bloomberg reported. headline: Chromologics raises €7 million to bring its natural colour ingredients closer to market - Yahoo Finance Singapore
summary_text: Advancing regulatory milestones and market readiness The latest funding comes at a pivotal moment for the food colouring industry. As a result of the recent scrutiny of synthetic colourants, which has led to the ban of synthetic Red 3 in the United States, the demand for natural, heat- and pH-stable alternatives is now increasing further among food and beverage producers. [...] The funding will enable Chromologics to complete regulatory submissions for its natural food colour, Natu.Red®, with the European Food Safety Authority (EFSA) and the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA). It will also support the subsequent product launch and the scale-up of production in collaboration with its large-scale CMO partner providing access to high-capacity fermentation facilities. Chromologics is a spin-out from the Technical University of Denmark (DTU), and Novo Holdings and EIFO have backed the company since 2020 with a shared conviction of the market potential for fermentation-derived natural c

headline: Klöckner Pentaplast successfully completes financial restructuring

headline: KP emerges from bankruptcy proceedings with new owner
summary_text: Plastic packaging and film maker Klöckner Pentaplast Group is emerging from U.S. Bankruptcy Court protection with a healthier balance sheet and what the company calls confidence.

headline: Klöckner Pentaplast successfully completes financial restructuring
summary_text: LONDON, Jan. 30, 2026 /PRNewswire/ - Klöckner Pentaplast ("kp" or the "Company") today announced that it has successfully completed its financial restructuring and emerged from the US Chapter 11 process. With the support of new ownership and a significantly strengthened financial foundation, kp is well positioned to continue serving its customers, delivering its leading portfolio, and driving cutting-edge innovation for the long term. With the financial restructuring process concluded, kp emerges having eliminated approximately €1.3 billion of funded debt. The Company's ongoing operations are further supported by €349 million in new capital received in connection with the process. With a significantly strengthened balance sheet and enhanced financial flexibility, kp enters its next phase with confidence and is well prepared to drive results.

headline: Klöckner Pentaplast receives approval for its reorganisation plans
summary_text: Klöckner Pentaplast (KP) has announced that the United States Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of Texas has approved its Plan of Reorganisation. This will allow KP to complete its financial restructuring and quickly emerge from the US Chapter 11 process. The Plan was developed and financed with the support of a group of KP's first-lien lenders and noteholders. × Expand Klöckner Pentaplast Klöckner Pentaplast receives approval for its reorganisation plans. Following its emergence, KP will eliminate around €1.3 billion of funded debt.

summary_text: All publicly traded companies with more than US$1 billion in revenue are assessed across three sustainable economy key performance indicators, including percentage of sustainable revenue and percentage of sustainable investment. Companies engaging in "red flag" activities such as thermal coal, blocking climate policy and deforestation are disqualified. The Global 100 methodology illuminates the "say-do" gap. Only those companies making sustainable solutions a core part of their business offerings, and allocating meaningful investments to this goal, make the grade. Its media division publishes the award-winning sustainable-economy magazine Corporate Knights, circulated in The Globe and Mail, The Washington Post and The Wall Street Journal. Its research division produces sustainability rankings, research reports and financial product ratings based on corporate sustainability performance.
