headline: GKN Automotive wins prestigious EcoVadis Platinum rating for sustainability - The Manufacturer
summary_text: “We’re proud of the progress made over the last four years, building on the successes of our EcoVadis Gold rating in 2024, and we remain focused on reaching our long-term goals as we continue to improve, innovate, and lead with purpose.” EcoVadis, an independent global sustainability assessor, enables organisations to benchmark their sustainability performance through a rigorous assessment of 21 sustainability criteria. The assessment is split into four main categories – Environment, Labour and Human Rights, Ethics and Sustainable Procurement – with the criteria based on international sustainability standards.1 [...] GKN Automotive achieved a score of 100/100 on six out of the seven Environment categories in 2025, leading to a top-ranking overall score of 86/100. The category showing the most improvement was Sustainable Procurement, with a 16-point increase over the previous year. headline: KP emerges from bankruptcy proceedings with new owner
summary_text: Plastic packaging and film maker Klöckner Pentaplast Group is emerging from U.S. Bankruptcy Court protection with a healthier balance sheet and what the company calls confidence.

headline: Klöckner Pentaplast successfully completes financial restructuring
summary_text: LONDON, Jan. 30, 2026 /PRNewswire/ - Klöckner Pentaplast ("kp" or the "Company") today announced that it has successfully completed its financial restructuring and emerged from the US Chapter 11 process. With the support of new ownership and a significantly strengthened financial foundation, kp is well positioned to continue serving its customers, delivering its leading portfolio, and driving cutting-edge innovation for the long term. With the financial restructuring process concluded, kp emerges having eliminated approximately €1.3 billion of funded debt. The Company's ongoing operations are further supported by €349 million in new capital received in connection with the process. With a significantly strengthened balance sheet and enhanced financial flexibility, kp enters its next phase with confidence and is well prepared to drive results.

headline: Klöckner Pentaplast receives approval for its reorganisation plans
summary_text: Klöckner Pentaplast (KP) has announced that the United States Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of Texas has approved its Plan of Reorganisation. This will allow KP to complete its financial restructuring and quickly emerge from the US Chapter 11 process. The Plan was developed and financed with the support of a group of KP's first-lien lenders and noteholders. × Expand Klöckner Pentaplast Klöckner Pentaplast receives approval for its reorganisation plans. Following its emergence, KP will eliminate around €1.3 billion of funded debt.

summary_text: The DOJ would have to sue to block the merger, and Netflix has signaled a willingness to challenge such a move in court. Cory Booker, the top Democrat on the subcommittee, said that he invited Paramount CEO David Ellison to the hearing, but he declined. Paramount is making a rival bid for all of Warner Bros. Discovery. Booker said that Ellison told him he did not find participating in a public hearing “useful or helpful.” The ranking member did reveal that he had a private meeting with Ellison, but noted he would have preferred to see the CEO out in public like Sarandos. Booker expressed concerns about Netflix and Paramount taking control of the fabled studio. [...] ### Watch on Deadline

headline: After the Mega-Merger: What fate awaits India’s Big Six Agencies- BBDO, TBWA, DDB, McCann, FCB and MullenLowe
summary_text: Post-Omnicom-IPG merger, McCann Worldgroup India remains a strong brand but faces leadership churn. Prasoon Joshi continues as CEO & CCO of McCann Worldgroup India and Chairman of McCann Asia Pacific. The merger places India’s top agencies under one global roof with potential consolidation and strategic positioning.

headline: Omnicom reveals huge agency shake-up, unveils new leadership, cuts 4,000 jobs
summary_text: Omnicom consolidates its creative networks to BBDO, TBWA, and McCann, with FCB folding into BBDO. Tyler Turnbull moves from FCB to CEO of McCann, and Javier Campopiano takes a global creative role. The restructuring includes 4,000 job cuts and aims to streamline operations post-IPG acquisition.

headline: Omnicom Unveils New Organization and Key Appointments Following IPG Acquisition
summary_text: Omnicom's restructuring after acquiring IPG includes Tyler Turnbull becoming global CEO of McCann, succeeding Daryl Lee who becomes chairman. Andrés Ordóñez steps in as McCann’s global chief creative officer, and Javier Campopiano takes a global creative role at Omnicom Advertising.

headline: FCB’s Tyler Turnbull set for top job at McCann Worldgroup post Omnicom–IPG merger
summary_text: Following Omnicom’s acquisition of Interpublic Group (IPG), Tyler Turnbull, former Global CEO of FCB, is appointed CEO of McCann Worldgroup, replacing Daryl Lee. This leadership change is part of a broader restructuring at McCann and Omnicom globally, with significant interest in the role of Prasoon Joshi in India.

headline: Omnicom consolidates global advertising agencies into TBWA, McCann and BBDO
summary_text: Omnicom will consolidate its advertising business into three global networks: TBWA, McCann, and BBDO, following its acquisition of Interpublic. Tyler Turnbull will run McCann as chief executive, and Javier Campopiano becomes global chief creative officer for Omnicom Advertising.

headline: Omnicom merges McCann and MullenLowe Singapore under McCann banner; Paul Soon and Gonzalo Olivera to lead
summary_text: Post-Omnicom acquisition of IPG, McCann and MullenLowe Singapore merged under the McCann brand to form a single creative agency. Paul Soon and Gonzalo Olivera appointed to lead the combined agency, enhancing creative leadership and regional capabilities in Southeast Asia.

headline: Digital dominates as TV loses ground in government media spend
summary_text: Universal McCann, as the government’s master agency, managed $42 million in media placement with a shift favoring digital channels over television. This reflects a strategic media mix change with digital receiving a 10% boost, highlighting UM's role in evolving media strategies.

headline: Earnings Call Transcript: Universal Q3 2026 Misses EPS Forecast, Stock Drops
summary_text: Universal Corporation (UVV) reported disappointing Q3 FY2026 financial results, missing EPS and revenue forecasts. The company refinanced its corporate credit facility by $250 million, expanding liquidity to $917 million and net debt at $995 million. Focus remains on scaling Universal Ingredients platform, net-zero emissions by 2050, and navigating tobacco market transitions amid customer headwinds.

headline: Universal McCann (UM) Company Profile and Operations
summary_text: Universal McCann (UM) is a global media and advertising agency under IPG Mediabrands (Interpublic Group), operating in over 100 countries with 3,000+ employees. Serves clients like American Express, Johnson & Johnson; focuses on marketing, media, and communications sectors with a people-first approach.

headline: Boom Goes The Omnicom - ADWEEK
summary_text: Subscribe Sign In Agencies Brands Creativity Media TV Commerce Tech Creators # Boom Goes The Omnicom ## Everything you need to know about the new mega-holdco By Alison Weissbrot After a year of anticipation and regulatory review, Omnicom has closed its $13.5 billion acquisition of IPG—and a lot is changing at the holdco. Led by CEO John Wren, the new Omnicom will span capabilities across creative, media, PR, precision marketing, production, commerce, data, and health marketing. It’s all underpinned by a souped-up version of its Omni platform, powered by Acxiom’s Real ID. In this new set up, Omnicom will eliminate three storied agency names—DDB, FCB, and MullenLowe—operating three global creative networks in BBDO, McCann, and TBWA. headline: The Deals That Made 2025 a Landmark Year for Ad and Media M&A - ADWEEK
summary_text: In the foreground is advertising holdco Omnicom’s $13.5 billion acquisition of former rival Interpublic Group (IPG), finalized in late November. It’s the largest deal in advertising history, with reverberations that have rocked the industry. “Omnicom and IPG is the most important deal of the year in the industry,” said Michael Kassan, dealmaker extraordinaire to the world’s media titans. “The industrial logic there is clear. As we get to the next level of technology, the combination and the size that they’ve been able to achieve is going to give an advantage.” #### Kendra Barnett Kendra Barnett is Adweek's senior tech reporter. @KendraEBarnett| kendra.barnett@adweek.com Recommended videos ## Media #### The 6 AI Trends That Will Dominate 2026 By Trishla Ostwal [...] Subscribe Sign In Agencies Brands Creativity Media TV Commerce Tech Creators SUBSCRIPTION ONLY ### Merger & Acquisition News # 2025: The Year AI, Mega-Mergers, and Mad Money Shook Media and Advertising #

summary_text: The newsletter software firm plans to double the size of its advertising product and operations team in the first half of 2026, cofounder and CEO Tyler Denk told ADWEEK. headline: The 5 Media Trends I’m Thankful For - ADWEEK
summary_text: These publishers might be small, but their continuity feels far more assured than that of the media giants of yesteryear. Even as it was happening, the multibillion-dollar valuations of sites like BuzzFeed, Vice, Vox, and Business Insider felt like the product of a fever dream. Maybe media has learned from its mistakes, at least to some degree, and the newest torch-bearers are far more durable than their predecessors. #### 5. Publishers, meet marketing Despite their reliance on advertising, publishers have been oddly loath to market themselves. This year, that began to change. [...] Publishers thinking of themselves not so much as news or entertainment firms, but as brands whose product is a specific kind of information, will find themselves far better positioned to compete in an ecosystem where content and data are ubiquitous. It might be an awkward evolution, but it is one long past due. #### Mark Stenberg Mark Stenberg is Adweek's senior media reporter. @markstenberg3| mark.ste

headline: ADWEEK Agencies Advantage: Upskilling Is Imperative As Industry Sheds Thousands of Jobs - ADWEEK
summary_text: For agencies, November was defined by building anticipation toward the defining moment of the year: Omnicom’s takeover of IPG. Officially closing on Nov. 26, the deal brought together two of the largest agency networks to form a mega-holdco that will reshape the industry while impacting thousands of agency jobs. Layoffs, which culminated with 4,000 cuts announced on Dec. 1, have been rolling all year. headline: Call for Nominations: Introducing the 2026 ADWEEK Agency Vanguard Awards - ADWEEK
summary_text: As ADWEEK builds our Agency Vanguard program, Agency All-Stars has been renamed the Agency Vanguard Awards. All agency C-suite executives are eligible to enter. Each nominee is invited to submit the name of a so-called “next leader” on their team to be featured in the final list alongside them—someone who is the executive’s right-hand person, their critical collaborator. Nominees will be reviewed and selected internally by ADWEEK. The final list will be featured in the April issue of ADWEEK in print and online on 4/7/26. There is no entry fee; the final deadline for nominations is January 23, 2026. Please use the nomination form below to submit a candidate. summary_text: The company did indeed go to “practically everybody, and we quickly learned we were a very different company, doing everything,” meaning “producing across genres,” Thordarsson shared. And that didn’t fit the market focus at the time. “They were all looking for drama only,” he concluded. “We were doing so many different things that we realized our company didn’t fit the model. So we made a lot of changes in order to be a sellable company.” For example, the company stopped doing live broadcasts and closed down other businesses to make it “a clear target” for investors or buyers. [...] Why did Sagafilm feel it needed more scale? “We were about one-third of the whole [Icelandic] market, so it was quite big, and we felt that growing the company would only happen outside of it,” Thordarsson explained. headline: EXCLUSIVE: How The Chernin Group’s Content-to-Commerce Bet Came Crashing Down - ADWEEK
summary_text: The used-bike marketplace, once a pandemic darling, had grown from a garage eBay hustle into a venture-backed business that brought in around $75 million in annual revenue in 2022, according to three people familiar with its finances. But its final years were marked by shrinking sales, steep losses, and the fallout from its ill-fated acquisition of a retail media brand. At the same time, a similar story was unfolding elsewhere. summary_text: FRANKFURT (dpa-AFX) - More digitalization, fewer branches: Deutsche Bank is continuing to overhaul its retail banking business. "By the end of 2026, around 100 more locations will be closed as part of existing programs, following reductions in recent years," said Claudio de Sanctis, Head of Retail Banking, to the news agencies dpa and dpa-AFX in Frankfurt.

headline: Commerzbank übertrifft Gewinnziel und startet weiteren Aktienrückkauf über bis zu 540 Mio. Euro
summary_text: Commerzbank hat ihr Gewinnziel für 2025 übertroffen und startet ab 12. Februar ein Aktienrückkaufprogramm im Volumen von bis zu 540 Mio. Euro. Zudem plant die Bank, der Hauptversammlung am 20. Mai 2026 eine deutlich erhöhte Dividende von 1,10 Euro je Aktie vorzuschlagen, im Vergleich zu 0,65 Euro im Vorjahr.

headline: Commerzbank verdient mehr als erwartet - höhere Dividende
summary_text: Die Commerzbank erzielte 2024 mit knapp 2,7 Milliarden Euro den höchsten Gewinn ihrer Geschichte. Im Zuge des Gewinnanstiegs plant die Bank eine höhere Dividende und wehrt sich gegen eine Übernahme durch die Unicredit, die mit über 26 Prozent größter Aktionär ist.

headline: Commerzbank AG: Rekorddividende und Spannung vor Jahresergebnis 2025
summary_text: Vor der Veröffentlichung des Jahresergebnisses 2025 am 11. Februar erwartet die Commerzbank eine Rekorddividende und weitere Aktienrückkäufe. Die Bank steht vor einem entscheidenden Impuls, wobei Investoren auf die Erfüllung der hohen Profitabilitätserwartungen und den Ausblick für 2026 achten.

headline: Commerzbank stellt Führung im Mittelstandsgeschäft neu auf
summary_text: Die Commerzbank hat zwei prominente Neuzugänge in die Führung ihrer Mittelstandsbank geholt und setzt im Kreditgeschäft auf ein Eigengewächs. Dies ist Teil der strategischen Neuausrichtung im Mittelstandsgeschäft im Jahr 2025.

headline: Commerzbank: Risikovorstand Bernd Spalt scheidet 2026 aus
summary_text: Der Risikovorstand der Commerzbank, Bernd Spalt, wird sein Amt zum 31. Dezember 2026 niederlegen. Der Aufsichtsrat hat bereits die Suche nach einem Nachfolger eingeleitet. Gründe für seinen Rücktritt wurden nicht genannt.

headline: Commerzbank earns more than expected - higher dividend
summary_text: Commerzbank reports a 2025 net profit of €2.63 billion, exceeding targets despite job cut costs, planning to return €2.7 billion via higher €1.10/share dividend and €540 million buyback. This reflects strong financial health post-Unicredit takeover defense, with ongoing cost reductions, informing procurement and risk strategies.

headline: Commerzbank to implement €540 million share buyback
summary_text: Commerzbank AG announces a new share buyback program of up to €540 million, following its €1 billion repurchase in 2025, to return 100% of its IFRS net income to shareholders, totaling €2.71 billion. The buyback will start after 2025 financial reporting and complete by March 26, 2026, alongside a proposed €1.10 per share dividend. This supports corporate finance strategies amid strong profitability.

headline: Commerzbank exceeds profit target - further share buyback
summary_text: Commerzbank surpasses 2025 profit targets and announces a €540 million share buyback starting February 2026, totaling €2.7 billion capital return to shareholders, highlighting financial strength for strategic planning.

headline: Commerzbank AG: How a Century-Old Lender Is Rebuilding a Digital-First
summary_text: Commerzbank is transforming into a digital universal bank with modernized core ledger, end-to-end digital workflows for loans, SME accounts, trade finance, cash management, FX, and green financing. Emphasizes data analytics, API scalability, deep Mittelstand integration for tailored risk pricing and supply chain solutions, aiding product innovations and supplier negotiations.

headline: Commerzbank completes share buyback of around €1bn
summary_text: Commerzbank finalizes its historic €1 billion share buyback on December 18, 2025, as the fifth tranche, demonstrating robust capital return strategy following strong 2025 performance, relevant for corporate finance planning.

headline: Destinus raises €50M facility to expand autonomous flight production
summary_text: Dutch aerospace and defencetech company Destinus has secured a €50 million financing facility from Commerzbank, marking the company's first commercial bank facility and supporting the next phase of its industrial expansion across Europe.

headline: German property bank PBB posts drop in net profit - TradingView
summary_text: Get started # German property bank PBB posts drop in net profit RefinitivLess than 1 min read PBB Deutsche Pfandbriefbank PBB (PBB), one of Germany's top property financiers, on Thursday posted a 56% drop in third-quarter net profit, and said its outlook for the final three months of the year was "cautious" and it expected a full-year pre-tax loss. The bank's quarterly post-tax profit was 15 million euros ($17.49 million), compared with 34 million euros a year earlier, while provisions for loan losses were 33 million euros, compared with 37 million euros a year earlier. headline: 🗂️ What the CMA reforms mean for law firms
summary_text: The government wants the CMA (the UK’s competition regulator) to interfere less in deals and move faster when it*does*step in. Fewer mergers would be reviewed, decisions should come quicker, and old rules that cost businesses money may be scrapped. This would mean faster deals and less uncertainty for companies (making the UK a better place to do business).

headline: Linklaters designates William Liu as chair of Asia
summary_text: Linklaters appointed William Liu, a capital markets partner, as chair of Asia to advance the firm's regional strategy. Liu has extensive experience in Asia, including leading major restructuring and refinancing deals, signaling a strategic focus on strengthening Linklaters' presence in the Asian market.

headline: Linklaters advises Cheyne Capital on €137.5M financing
summary_text: Linklaters advised Cheyne Capital on a €137.5 million financing deal with Arab Bank Switzerland for real estate acquisition and redevelopment in Portugal. This significant transaction marks an important milestone in Cheyne Capital’s investment strategy and involved a multidisciplinary team across multiple Linklaters offices.

headline: Linklaters announces move to new global headquarters
summary_text: Linklaters announced its relocation to a new global headquarters at 20 Ropemaker Street, London, aiming to enhance service delivery with modern facilities for clients and staff. This strategic move reflects the firm's commitment to providing high-level services in a contemporary environment.

headline: Linklaters unveils modern sustainable headquarters in London’s financial district
summary_text: Linklaters relocated its global headquarters to 20 Ropemaker Street, London, after 30 years at One Silk Street. The new 360,000-square-foot office spans 17 floors with sustainable design features, collaborative workspaces, fitness facilities, and panoramic city views, emphasizing the firm's investment in culture and sustainability.

headline: Linklaters, Ashurst lead as APAC restructuring mandates surge in Q4 2025 on China real estate crunch
summary_text: Linklaters led restructuring mandates in the Asia-Pacific region during Q4 2025 amid the China real estate market crisis. This highlights the firm's active role in significant regional restructuring and insolvency matters, reinforcing its market positioning in APAC.

headline: Linklaters appoints Julian Cunningham-Day as Global Practice Head of TMT/IP
summary_text: Linklaters appointed Julian Cunningham-Day as Global Practice Head of TMT/IP, effective from January 1, 2026. Julian is a TMT partner in London and co-heads Fintech and Telecoms, reflecting a strategic leadership move in technology and intellectual property sectors.

headline: Linklaters advises on Zijin Mining’s US$1.5bn zero-coupon H-share convertible bond offering
summary_text: Linklaters advised bookrunners on Zijin Mining’s US$1.5bn zero-coupon H-share convertible bonds with negative-yield structure, the first such in Asia-Pacific mining sector and largest globally in 2026, enhancing offshore capital access.

headline: Linklaters advises QIA on launch of S$8.2bn private real estate fund in Singapore
summary_text: Linklaters advised Qatar Investment Authority (QIA) on partnering with Hongkong Land to launch the S$8.2bn Singapore Central Private Real Estate Fund (SCPREF), the largest commercial private fund in Singapore, focused on prime commercial assets. QIA contributed Asia Square Tower 1 to the initial portfolio.

headline: Linklaters advises lenders on €120 million sustainability-linked financing for Cabo Verde airports
summary_text: Linklaters advised IFC, DEG, and EAAIF on a €120m sustainability-linked loan to VINCI Airports for Cabo Verde airport upgrades, including capacity expansions, digital solutions, and environmental improvements like solar power. This follows a prior €60m facility and supports 60% passenger growth.

headline: Linklaters advises on the RMB 6bn convertible bonds issuance by Zoomlion Heavy Industry Science and Technology
summary_text: Linklaters advised bookrunners on Zoomlion’s RMB 6bn US dollar-settled H-share convertible bonds, the largest RMB-denominated and first under specific mandate from an A+H company, boosting H-share liquidity and global strategy.

headline: Linklaters advises lenders on financing of CIP’s acquisition of Ørsted’s European onshore business
summary_text: Linklaters advised lenders on the financing for Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners’ (CIP) acquisition of Ørsted’s European onshore business, including over 800 MW of wind, solar, and BESS projects and a multi-gigawatt development pipeline. The transaction is subject to regulatory approvals and expected to complete mid-2026, highlighting Linklaters’ expertise in energy transition financings.

headline: Linklaters advises Permira and Warburg Pincus on sale of Evelyn Partners to NatWest
summary_text: Linklaters advised private equity firms Permira and Warburg Pincus on the £2.7bn sale of wealth management group Evelyn Partners to NatWest Group, subject to regulatory approval and expected to complete summer 2026.

headline: Linklaters advises NATIXIS and Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria on innovative US$300m equity investment in Polestar
summary_text: Linklaters advised NATIXIS and BBVA on a US$300m PIPE investment in Polestar, featuring an equity derivative structure with put options for exit certainty. This supports Polestar’s liquidity and Geely’s growth strategy, showcasing innovative financing across multiple jurisdictions.

headline: Linklaters advises the banks on Edenred’s EUR 500 million bond issue under its EMTN programme
summary_text: Linklaters advised banks on Edenred’s first EUR 500m bond issue under its EMTN programme, with 3.75% coupon maturing 2033, used for general corporate purposes including refinancing a maturing bond. This builds on prior advice for establishing the EMTN programme.

headline: Linklaters unveils 20-strong 'AI lawyer' team
summary_text: Magic Circle giant Linklaters has launched a team of 20 'AI Lawyers' (yes, that is their actual job title) as it ramps up its commitment to artificial intelligence across its global offices. The new cohort is a mix of external tech specialists and Linklaters lawyers who have decided to boost their legal expertise with advanced AI know-how. They will be placed into practice groups around the world to help build prompts, workflows and other tech driven processes that the firm hopes will sharpen client delivery. Before they get started, the group will attend what the firm describes as an AI 'bootcamp' . The programme covers Links' approach to AI, power user features in its tools, the basics of change management, and how to write prompts that minimise the risk of generative AI hallucinations, a hazard Legal Cheek has covered before.

headline: The Sports Industry Isn't All About the Game—It's a High ...

headline: Call for Papers: 2026 Nordic Household Finance Summit
summary_text: The Center for Big Data in Finance (BIGFI) at Copenhagen Business School (CBS) is hosting the inaugural Nordic Household Finance Summit on June 1–2, 2026, in Copenhagen. It invites submissions on household finance topics like borrowing, saving, financial frictions, fintech, and behavioral approaches, emphasizing empirical work with administrative data. Submissions are due February 22, 2026; travel costs covered for presenters.

headline: CBS Ends Relationship With Contributor Dr. Peter Attia Following Jeffrey Epstein Revelations
summary_text: CBS News is expected to cut ties with contributor Dr. Peter Attia after his connections to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein were highlighted in recently released emails, the Wrap reported Monday.

headline: CBS News star Gayle King defended top editor Bari Weiss and criticized leakers, leaked audio reveals
summary_text: Gayle King is tired of the negativity at CBS News and the grumbling about top editor Bari Weiss. During a company town hall on Tuesday, the "CBS Mornings" star said she was "very proud" of the work the broadcast network had been doing despite noise and criticism about Weiss' editorial decisions. " This is very bumpy times for all of us, and we do n't know how it's going to turn out ," King said in the all-hands meeting, according to an audio recording obtained by Business Insider. " But I do know that we want to work hard and do a good job ." King said Weiss' vision for CBS News "makes sense ," after the editor in chief told staffers the network must "shift to a streaming mentality immediately" and away from traditional TV.

headline: Report: CBS Could Ax Pelley Over Weiss Criticism
summary_text: " 60 Minutes" correspondents Scott Pelley and Sharyn Alfonsi could be fired by CBS News after publicly and repeatedly criticizing new editor-in-chief Bari Weiss, the New York Post reported Thursday.

headline: 'CBS Evening News' No. 2 Producer Dismissed Amid Tony Dokoupil's Rocky Rollout
summary_text: Javier Guzman, a senior broadcast producer for "CBS Evening News ," was dismissed from his position following Wednesday's broadcast, just days into Tony Dokoupil's tenure as anchor, two sources familiar with the matter told TheWrap.

headline: CBS News execs spark backlash with sudden layoffs on critical team: 'No longer aligned'
summary_text: CBS News has faced criticism following the controversial decision to slash its climate news team. What's happening ? After a highly publicized leadership change at CBS News, some feared major shifts could be in store for the heralded media company. Among those shifts came a drastic reduction in the team dedicated to covering rising global temperatures and related disasters. The Washington Post reported in early November that four producers were laid off from what Heated described as a five-person team, with one producer potentially reassigned.

headline: The Tony Dokoupil era begins at 'CBS Evening News'
summary_text: Tony Dokoupil took his place at the anchor desk of the "CBS Evening News" on Monday as the troubled news division undergoes reinvention under its new editor in chief, Bari Weiss. Dokoupil was supposed to start his run with a trip to 10 cities across the U.S., to connect with viewers outside of the media centers of New York and Washington. CBS News leased a private 14-seat jet for the tour, but the plan was delayed once the U.S. military action in Venezuela became a major story early Saturday morning. Instead, Dokoupil took the chair Saturday night and broadcast live from San Francisco before returning to New York for his official premiere on Monday.

headline: Tony Dokoupil to Kick Off His 'CBS Evening News' Run 2 Days Early Amid News of Maduro Capture
summary_text: Tony Dokoupil will begin his new job at "CBS Evening News" two days earlier than planned, taking the anchor desk Saturday night for a special edition from San Francisco as the network covers the rapidly developing U.S. military action in Venezuela, a person with knowledge of the schedule change told TheWrap.

headline: Who Is Tony Dokoupil? 5 Things About the New 'CBS Evening News' Anchor
summary_text: Tony Dokoupil is stepping into one of broadcast television's most high-profile roles.

headline: Trump's 'Censorship' Continues As He 'Stopped' Segment On His 'Inhumane Treatment Of Immigrants'
summary_text: CBS News is facing internal backlash after its flagship programme, 60 Minutes, removed a segment titled 'Inside Cecot' from its Sunday night broadcast. The investigation, led by veteran correspondent Sharyn Alfonsi, reportedly detailed'state-sanctioned torture' within El Salvador's Cecot megaprison, where the administration has deported hundreds of Venezuelan migrants. Although the segment received multiple approvals from CBS lawyers and standards executives, it was removed just hours before airing following a decision from the network's new editor-in-chief, Bari Weiss. Internal Strife And Allegations Of Political Interference. The move to pull the segment has sparked a firestorm inside the storied news organization, with veteran journalists accusing the network of "corporate censorship ."

headline: Critics Blast CBS' Bari Weiss for Pulling '60 Minutes' Report on Trump Deportations: 'Government-Controlled TV'
summary_text: CBS News editor-in-chief Bari Weiss is under fire over her decision to pull a "60 Minutes" segment on the Trump administration's deportation of Venezuelan migrants to a prison in El Salvador, with one critic calling it "government-controlled TV ."

headline: CBS News commits to more town hall and debate telecasts with a major sponsor
summary_text: CBS News is moving forward with a series of town hall and debate telecasts with a major advertiser backing them, the first major initiative under editor-in-chief Bari Weiss. The news division announced Thursday it will have a series of one hour single issue programs under the title "Things That Matter" done in collaboration with the digital platform the Free Press. CBS News parent Paramount acquired the Free Press which was co-founded by Weiss, in September. Advertisement. Bank of America will be a major sponsor of the series.

headline: CBS News: 'Fraud Tourists' Told Minnesota State Programs Were a Good Opportunity to Make Money
summary_text: There was much gnashing of teeth and rending of garments when CBS News announced that it had hired left-of-center Bari Weiss as its editor in chief.

headline: Bari Weiss Names Israel Defender to Top CBS News Anchor Job
summary_text: Bari Weiss, the polarizing new editor-in-chief of CBS News, has named the longtime network personality Tony Dokoupil to anchor the evening news chair, in a potential sign of how Weiss' pro-Israel views may be reshaping the network's news priorities.

headline: CBS appoints Tony Dokoupil as anchor of its flagship 'CBS Evening News' broadcast
summary_text: CBS News appointed Tony Dokoupil as anchor of the "CBS Evening News" on Wednesday, charging him with taking on ABC's dominant David Muir on one of the flagship shows for broadcast television.

headline: Who is Tony Dokoupil? All about new CBS Evening News anchor
summary_text: CBS just revealed big changes: Tony Dokoupil, currently co-hosting CBS Mornings, will step into the anchor chair for CBS Evening News.

headline: Tony Dokoupil named 'CBS Evening News' anchor in Weiss' network revamp
summary_text: CBS News has named Tony Dokoupil anchor of its flagship "CBS Evening News" starting January 5 in one of the first major moves under new editor-in-chief Bari Weiss as she overhauls the network.

headline: Bari Weiss Picks Tony Dokoupil to Anchor CBS Evening News
summary_text: CBS News, under Larry Ellison's hand-picked self-described "Zionist fanatic" editor-in-chief Bari Weiss, has reportedly selected former hair model Tony Dokoupil to anchor CBS Evening News.

headline: Tony Dokoupil named anchor of 'CBS Evening News'
summary_text: Tony Dokoupil has been named anchor of "CBS Evening News ," one of the most prominent jobs in television journalism, CBS News announced Wednesday.

headline: The Week In Media: CBS News Drama, WBD Bids, And Olivia Nuzzi Returns - Forbes
summary_text: Here’s a look at some of the people and players that drove media headlines over the past week. Bari Weiss is still shaping her vision for CBS News. The latest press coverage of Bari Weiss—hired by Paramount Skydance CEO David Ellison to revamp CBS News—casts the 41-year-old founder of The Free Press as a disruptor on a mission, with new profiles zeroing in on her vow to “blow this up” (referring to the status quo at CBS News). [...] Sinclair acquires a stake in Scripps. In other media news,Sinclair Broadcast Group revealed this week that it’s taken an 8.2% stake in E.W. Scripps, a move that could well serve as prelude to a possible takeover bid. The company’s disclosure shows how local TV groups are scrambling to consolidate while cord-cutting continues to pick up steam. It also hints at a broader industry push to get bigger ahead of regulatory and market shifts. The correspondent on the piece, Sharyn Alfonsi, issued a blistering note to colleagues about the decision, calling it political. It eventually aired a month later. ### Watch on Deadline In the announcement of the “all hands meeting,” employees were asked to submit questions for Weiss. headline: Here Are TVNewser’s Top 5 Stories of 2025 - ADWEEK
summary_text: Subscribe Sign In Agencies Brands Creativity Media TV Commerce Tech Creators # Here Are TVNewser’s Top 5 Stories of 2025 ## Change within the news industry generated the most eyeballs By Mark Mwachiro Happy New Year, Newsers. As the smoke clears from the many fireworks that illuminated the sky and the confetti is swept up, the news media landscape in 2026 remains uncertain. The evolution of CBS News and who owns CNN will certainly generate significant digital discourse over the new year. Yet the two largest transactions of all time were struck a quarter century ago by telecom titan Vodafone and erstwhile internet pioneer America Online. Expect those records to fall in 2026. headline: PwC is rethinking how to train workers in the Al era, and it's betting on 'skills, not titles'
summary_text: PwC has launched what it's calling the "Learning Collective ," a new workplace training initiative designed for the realities of the AI era. It's a broad rethink of how learning happens inside one of the world's largest professional services firms. " Skills, not titles, are the currency of this new era ," the firm said in a press release. The line was reminiscent of news from January, first reported by Business Insider, that fellow Big Four firm Deloitte is overhauling job titles for all of its professionals. From June 1, simple, traditional job roles like "consultant" and "associate" will be replaced by more specific descriptors that better reflect the work Deloitte carries out for clients.

headline: Deloitte is overhauling job titles for its US workforce - here's why
summary_text: The Big Four firm Deloitte is rolling out a sweeping overhaul of how it refers to its US workforce and introducing a new class of leader. " All professionals will receive a new title that we will start to use internally and externally on June 1, 2026 ," said a presentation shared with employees during a meeting on Wednesday morning, which Business Insider has seen. Deloitte plans to tell employees their new job titles on January 29, before they take effect at the start of the firm's next financial year in June. The meeting, hosted by Mo Reynolds, Deloitte US's chief people officer, was held for the consulting division, but the changes apply to all Deloitte's US divisions, the presentation said. Deloitte had 181,500 employees in the US as of May 31, 2025.

headline: LSBF Singapore Campus and Deloitte Elevate Diploma Education in Singapore with Industry-Driven Learning
summary_text: LSBF Singapore Campus and Deloitte Elevate Diploma Education in Singapore with Industry-Driven Learning. SINGAPORE, Jan. 20, 2026 /PRNewswire/ - Building on a successful collaboration launched in 2024, London School of Business and Finance (LSBF) Singapore Campus and Deloitte are taking their partnership to the next level, bringing real-world industry expertise directly into LSBF's Diploma, Higher Diploma, and Career Immersion programmes. This expanded collaboration underscores a shared mission: to produce career-ready graduates equipped with both academic rigour and practical insights from one of the world's leading professional services firms. Dual-Branded, Industry-Endorsed Programmes. Selected Diploma and Higher Diploma programmes will incorporate a Deloitte co-delivered module, reinforcing LSBF's commitment to industry-relevant education and curriculum aligned with the expectations of leading professional services firms.

headline: Pearson and Deloitte announce new alliance to equip enterprises and government organizations with AI-powered learning and address the global skills gap
summary_text: Pearson and Deloitte announce new alliance to equip enterprises and government organizations with AI-powered learning and address the global skills gap. NEW YORK and LONDON, Jan. 13, 2026 /PRNewswire/ - Pearson (FTSE: PSON.L) and Deloitte today announced an alliance to co-develop and deliver end-to-end talent, leadership, and workforce development solutions for global enterprises and government organizations. The collaboration will draw upon Deloitte and Pearson's distinctive, industry-specific experience and breadth of capabilities to develop products and services that address immediate market needs including AI learning, leadership development, and learning solutions for customers and partners. To meet evolving talent demands, Pearson and Deloitte will also create new learning capabilities. These offerings will include a range of solutions enhanced by AI, from industry and in-role skills intelligence platforms to scaled learning, content delivery, assessment, and credentialing.

headline: Deloitte Taiwan and C2A Security Partner to Accelerate Innovation in Product Security and Risk Management
summary_text: The partnership between Deloitte and C2A Security brings immense value to customers, as the two companies develop unique offerings.This alliance builds on proven success with global leaders such as Elekta and Daimler Truck AG, which rely on C2A's platform to meet complex regulatory requirements while maintaining operational efficiency.Taiwanese companies face unique cybersecurity challenges: • Companies must comply with CRA, IEC 62443, UN R155/R156, and other international standards. A lack of an automated, integrated platform makes compliance slow and resource intensive.• Global OEMs increasingly require suppliers to demonstrate robust cybersecurity practices. Without real-time compliance reporting and data consolidation, Taiwanese companies face delays and potentially lost opportunities.• Manual testing methods can not keep pace with modern product complexity. Automated platforms for risk analysis, vulnerability detection, and continuous monitoring are essential for rapid response.• A limited pool of experts in embedded and industrial cybersecurity makes it difficult for companies to sustain long-term security and compliance efforts without workflow streamlining technologies.C2A Security's EVSec platform delivers AI-driven, context - based risk management for organizations developing connected technologies, enabling fast and accurate vulnerability and security operations management. The acquisition of VigilantOps expands C2A's SBOM and MedTech capabilities.

headline: PwC to increase engagement with digital asset firms
summary_text: Big four accountancy firm PriceWaterhouseCooper (PwC) has decided to ditch the more cautious stance it has maintained towards digital assets up to now and "lean in" to the sector, following legislative progress and a shift away from hardline regulation since last January's inauguration of United States President Donald Trump, according to a report by the Financial Times. In a January 4 interview with the FT, Paul Griggs, U.S. Senior Partner and CEO of PwC, said the firm underwent a strategic reversal on digital assets last year as a result of the U.S. administration appointing pro-digital currency regulators and Congress passing new laws governing digital assets, namely stablecoins. " The Genius Act and the regulatory rulemaking around stablecoin I expect will create more conviction around leaning into that product and that asset class ," Griggs told the FT. "The tokenisation of things will certainly continue to evolve as well. PwC has to be in that ecosystem ." According to the FT report, up until the beginning of Trump's second term, which started last January, the 'Big Four' firms-Deloitte, EY, KPMG, and PwC-had avoided auditing many digital asset-related businesses in the U.S., due to a combination of the tough stance taken by regulators, particularly the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) , and a lack of clear legislation governing the space.

headline: Deloitte India Launches AI-Powered Tax Research Platform 'Tax Pragya'
summary_text: New Delhi [ India ], December 10 (ANI) : Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu India LLP has introduced Tax Pragya™, an artificial intelligence powered tax research platform designed to help professionals navigate India's increasingly complex tax landscape with greater speed and precision. Developed using Deloitte's long-standing tax expertise, the platform functions as an AI-enabled research assistant, offering advanced search, intuitive learning tools and cross-domain support across Income Tax, GST/Indirect Tax and Transfer Pricing. The launch comes at a time when India's tax ecosystem is undergoing rapid change, marked by frequent regulatory updates, expanded compliance requirements and intensified scrutiny. Deloitte officials said the platform aims to support organisations transitioning from traditional, manual processes to technology - led, insight-driven tax operations. By providing intelligence-backed analysis, Tax Pragya is intended to help tax professionals respond more quickly to evolving mandates while improving accuracy and reliability.

headline: Anthropic signs $200M deal to bring its LLMs to Snowflake's customers
summary_text: " This partnership brings Claude directly into Snowflake, where that data already lives. It's a meaningful step toward making frontier AI genuinely useful for businesses ." Anthropic has struck a slew of large enterprise deals in recent months as it seeks to prioritize selling to businesses instead of individual users - a strategy in contrast to its arch-rival OpenAI, which has taken a more popular route to growth. Anthropic in October signed a deal with Deloitte to bring its Claude chatbot to the consulting giant's employee base of more than 500,000 staff. That same week, Anthropic struck a partnership with IBM to bring some of its LLMs into the latter's software products.

headline: Deloitte Detected Using Fake AI Citations in $1 Million Report
summary_text: Related: Deloitte Is Reimbursing Employees Up to $ 1,000 - For Buying Lego Sets. The report additionally cited an academic paper from the Canadian Journal of Respiratory Therapy that can not be found in a search of its database. " Deloitte Canada firmly stands behind the recommendations put forward in our report ," a Deloitte Canada spokesperson told Fortune in a statement on Tuesday. " We are revising the report to make a small number of citation corrections, which do not impact the report findings. AI was not used to write the report; it was selectively used to support a small number of research citations ."

headline: Deloitte Adopts SAP Joule for Consultants Solution to Accelerate Value Delivery for SAP Projects
summary_text: By uniting SAP's advanced AI capabilities with Deloitte's deep industry knowledge, we 're equipping consultants with the solutions and the exclusive knowledge they need to address complex challenges and helping organizations realize even greater value from their SAP investments ," said Philipp Herzig, chief technology officer and chief AI officer, SAP SE. Designed specifically to support consulting teams, SAP Joule for Consultants acts as a digital, context-aware solution offering SAP project delivery support that taps proprietary SAP data and tools. Combined with Deloitte's domain and industry experience, SAP Joule for Consultants can enable several key benefits for consultants, including: Contextual awareness - The solution is grounded in SAP's most exclusive and up-to-date knowledge base, including over nine terabytes of SAP-specific knowledge and over three million non-public documents. Quality assurance - By delivering accurate and relevant information quickly, Joule helps consultants avoid redundant work and focus on higher-value strategic deliverables.

headline: Deloitte Unveils GivePrism, an AI-Engineered Solution That Accelerates Donor Impact for Nonprofits and Higher Education
summary_text: Deloitte Unveils GivePrism, an AI-Engineered Solution That Accelerates Donor Impact for Nonprofits and Higher Education. NEW YORK, Nov. 12, 2025 /PRNewswire/ - Every year, the holiday season brings a surge of activity and opportunity for colleges, universities and nonprofit organizations to engage existing donors and identify new donors. Deloitte's GivePrism, a next-generation, AI-powered solution, is engineered to help institutions and organizations rapidly identify, engage and inspire supporters, turning insights into measurable outcomes. " Many donors are inundated with emails, phone calls and text messages from institutions and organizations, making it easy for even the most impactful messages to get lost ," said Sean Conlin, principal, Deloitte Consulting LLP. " GivePrism is changing that equation by helping nonprofits and higher education clients use advanced analytics and AI to truly understand donor preferences and behaviors.

headline: Deloitte India and AWS chart a four-year roadmap for cloud and agentic AI-led digital transformation in India
summary_text: Vinay Prabhakar, Partner and Alliance Leader, Deloitte South Asia, said, "True transformation happens when organisations come together with a shared vision and complementary strengths. Through this expanded collaboration announced at Coalesce 2025, Deloitte and AWS are combining diverse capabilities and building a strategic framework that prioritises India-specific innovation, accelerates time-to-market and delivers co-created industry solutions. From financial services and the public sector to conglomerates and GCCs, our collaboration will help organisations grow with confidence and resilience, while shaping tomorrow's opportunities through cloud and AI-powered innovation ." Agentic AI Lab. With AWS, Deloitte India will establish the country's first AWS Agentic AI Lab, which will integrate into Deloitte's recently announced Asia Pacific Agentic AI CoE.

headline: How boring work is eroding productivity in finance teams - Accounting Today
summary_text: Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Email As 2026 approaches, finance teams are entering their most demanding stretch of the year — closing the books, shaping next year's investment and business strategies, and finalizing budgets. headline: How Much Is Big Tech Spending on AI Computing? A Staggering $650 Billion in 2026 - Bloomberg

headline: India Bond Entry Into Bloomberg Global Index Put on Hold
summary_text: Bloomberg Index Services on Tuesday deferred the inclusion of Indian bonds in its flagship Global Aggregate Index, disappointing some investors who had been expecting inclusion and sending yields higher. Overall, responses indicated broad support for the long-term trajectory of the Indian government bond market and for its potential eventual inclusion in global investment grade benchmarks, the service provider said in a note. Still, a number of respondents highlighted important operational and market-infrastructure considerations that merit further evaluation before inclusion in a flagship global investment grade index, it said.

headline: Bloomberg Defers Inclusion of Indian Bonds in Its Global Aggregate Index

headline: Bloomberg Law 2025 League Tables Reveal Top 20 M&A Law Firms
summary_text: ARLINGTON, Va., Jan. 2, 2026 /PRNewswire/ - Today, Bloomberg Law published league tables for 2025, with Latham & Watkins taking the top spot as Big Law's number one mergers and acquisitions adviser. The firm guided record-breaking transactions totaling global deals worth about $ 787 billion. Latham topped competitors Kirkland & Ellis ($ 743 billion) , Wachtell Lipton Rosen & Katz ($ 621 billion) , Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom ($ 550 billion) , and Simpson Thacher & Bartlett ($ 403 billion) . Global deal volume reached more than $ 4.7 trillion for completed or pending transactions, according to Bloomberg data, up 40 % from 2024.

headline: SEC Power to Recoup Illegal Profits at Risk as Justices Eye Case - Bloomberg Law News
summary_text: ### Products Bloomberg Terminal Data Trading Risk Compliance Indices ### Industry Products Bloomberg Law Bloomberg Tax Bloomberg Government Bloomberg Environment BloombergNEF ### Media Bloomberg Markets Bloomberg Technology Bloomberg Pursuits Bloomberg Politics Bloomberg Opinion Bloomberg Businessweek Bloomberg Live Conferences Bloomberg Radio Bloomberg Television News Bureaus ### Media Services Bloomberg Media Distribution Advertising ### Bloomberg [...] Photographer: Tierney L. Cross/Bloomberg The SEC’s practice of forcing defendants to relinquish profits from illegal activities, even when there’s no apparent harm to investors, is under scrutiny again as influential groups urge the US Supreme Court to take up a case that could limit the Wall Street cop’s powers.
